commit_message:
Force DIB Python version for py2 in diskimage-create

DIB automatically picks a Python version based on the distro and
version. For Ubuntu Bionic, that default is Python 3 which means the
amphora-agent does not run on Python 2 when it was expected to on -py2
jobs [1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/10/661310/8/check/ \
    octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-scenario/664a91b/controller/logs/dib-build/ \
    amphora-x64-haproxy.qcow2_log.txt.gz#_2019-07-27_15_51_58_393

Change-Id: I6fd12be06bc848b3e29828c091f61229703e3a57

commit_message:
Adds LibvirtLogFilters to define a libvirtd filter

LibvirtLogFilters to select a different logging level for a given
category log outputs, as specified in https://libvirt.org/logging.html .
Default:

'1:libvirt 1:qemu 1:conf 1:security 3:event 3:json 3:file 3:object 1:util'

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: Ic48afe856ae60654d6cebf627b12509881933c59
Change-Id: I85b09ddeb61b2f3563f81eb423e8f05b18fe984a
Closes-Bug: 1840140
(cherry picked from commit 71516f2816aa9705bbe74533957557269094fd32)

commit_message:
Move cephfs and cephfs_*_pool ceph-ansible parameters in -base

We have to move these into the -base service so they are dumped in
"all" ansible group vars and correctly consumed by nfs role
when not colocated with mds.

Closes-Bug: 1840651
Change-Id: I7aec1b80e0f598fc86720d669151958ca7b2e01d
(cherry picked from commit 04b1378ea1217db32aad4f03ad360da4c4df24dd)
(cherry picked from commit 90e36a106a4adc69805b25ec68a9d5a76377c209)

subject: Fix MariaDB staged upgrade
messages: [{'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2019-08-27 13:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-27 20:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 13:43:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix MariaDB staged upgrade

This patch fixes 2 issues on MariaDB staged upgrade:

* After we landed service stopping on the data transfer step, the
  actual MariaDB staged upgrade moved from step 1 to step 2 of
  external_upgrade_tasks, but we only ran steps 0 and 1 during the
  upgrade. Increase the number of steps to run step 2 as well.

* The mysql_upgrade container was being re-run on each upgrade-scaleup
  even on nodes where it already ran before and MariaDB was already
  running there, conflicting with the upgrade container. We fix this
  by only running the MariaDB upgrade if there's no MariaDB running
  yet on the particular node.

Change-Id: I2feba6c22cdf07ea6af406c5edd27f62ff285d87
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1841415
(cherry picked from commit 22f26d7a94db952d679e143c162b6e45b8e8b3d3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix MariaDB staged upgrade

This patch fixes 2 issues on MariaDB staged upgrade:

* After we landed service stopping on the data transfer step, the
  actual MariaDB staged upgrade moved from step 1 to step 2 of
  external_upgrade_tasks, but we only ran steps 0 and 1 during the
  upgrade. Increase the number of steps to run step 2 as well.

* The mysql_upgrade container was being re-run on each upgrade-scaleup
  even on nodes where it already ran before and MariaDB was already
  running there, conflicting with the upgrade container. We fix this
  by only running the MariaDB upgrade if there's no MariaDB running
  yet on the particular node.

Change-Id: I2feba6c22cdf07ea6af406c5edd27f62ff285d87
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1841415
(cherry picked from commit 22f26d7a94db952d679e143c162b6e45b8e8b3d3)

commit_message:
Update docs building

Follow PTI [1] for doc building:
* Create doc/requirements.txt file with all docs requirements.
* Switch to openstackdocstheme and update conf.py for this.
* Move doc8 to pep8 section since it's a linter.

Additionally:
* Fix all build errors with doc building.
* Update requirements list with license info.
* Use hacking instead of flake directly.
* Remove unused _static files, those are not needed.
* Update git URLs, fix contributor guide URL
* Move README.md to RST, everything else in this repo is RST
* Publish documents to docs.o.o - note that
  https://adjutant.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ was last updated  in March
  2018

This adds jobs for building of release notes - only building since
there's no content yet - and publishing of documentation.

Publishing of api-ref can be done via:
 https://review.opendev.org/675766

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: I82f56ef5ea800899b2a8db795b6cf2b21d03ac7a

commit_message:
Get usages in _build_provider_summaries()

For performance optimization purpose, we explored which provider is
already processed both in extend_usages_by_provider_tree() and in
_build_provider_summaries(), and we iterated all usage information
in _build_provider_summaries(), which could cost even when only one
request group has been given.

This patch refactors it and move get_usages_by_provider_trees()
into _build_provider_summaries() to combine the exploration parts
into one.

Change-Id: Ic36d453adf92b1f475960eb1b2796919d635da10

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I1177eeaa62abb3ea4e7bc2fb18ab8f82834e3077

commit_message:
Add response schema validation for volume capabilities

This is to add response schema validation for volume
capabilities, also to remove the fields check in testcases.

Change-Id: I37ac55fac80c6c237d17dad0192250774bd95d4b
partially-implements: blueprint volume-response-schema-validation

commit_message:
Blacklist eventlet 0.25.0

The related bug was fixed in eventlet 0.25.1, so we can now uncap kombu,
reverting [1], and instead blacklist eventlet 0.25.0. The latter must be
done first, which is what this commit does.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677070/

Change-Id: I39ed2c57015fcd291868e20fe2f3b657aa8f4eb3
Related-Bug: #1840551

commit_message:
Use promote job

Change doc publishing to a promote job so that we do not need to rebuild
docs in the post pipeline.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678351
Change-Id: I971160a2716f3cbdc64afb33dd191481cab1d4ea

commit_message:
Handle defined containers that are stopped.

Delete the stopped container and recreate it to ensure
there are no local modifications to the container.

Change-Id: Ia3fe06dd221d0894a5de2c18beaa48ba29440003
Resolves: rhbz#1674517
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 08:17:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see
the following error on the console, followed by a kernel panic:

Fix kernel panic-not syncing: VFS: unable to mount root fs on unknown
block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

The initrd argument is present in the kolla-ansible version of
inspector.ipxe, and now contains all parameters that we need (since

commit_message:
Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see
the following error on the console, followed by a kernel panic:

Fix kernel panic-not syncing: VFS: unable to mount root fs on unknown
block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

The initrd argument is present in the kolla-ansible version of
inspector.ipxe, and now contains all parameters that we need (since
Rocky), so this change simply removes our custom template, and passes
through the extra kernel argument option configuration value.

Story: 2006214
Task: 35804

Story: 2006213
Task: 35803

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/670566
Change-Id: I8a103b7c6d3dd1f0433f922ae90deae9b92c0c78
(cherry picked from commit 0ee55e19fa9889b807e72f7f018800a1761d92a0)

commit_message:
Add check for string type dport

the dport option could be a port number using a string instead of a array or int.
This change ensures our loop is able to properly handle dport options written as
list, string, or int.

Change-Id: I13dbdb2043ad216d1c89801c974508dd9b958cdc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Move 1 v3 identity token test to work w/ pre-prov

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials for the test:

* test_get_available_project_scopes

Note that these tests aren't interop tests [0] so can
be safely moved.

The following test is not moved because it creates a group
with a user and results in a forbidden error when doing so
with a backend like LDAP:

* test_get_available_domain_scopes

tempest.lib.exceptions.Forbidden: Forbidden
Details: {u'message': u'Group membership across backend
  boundaries is not allowed. Group in question is
  0300895387b14ea4a570deb8a22b5ef1, user is primary.',
  u'code': 403, u'title': u'Forbidden'}

The following test is not moved because it is an
interop test[0]:

* test_rescope_token

[0] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=admin.v3.test_tokens&i=nope&files=&repos=interop

Change-Id: I2ec350f9db3afd053761be7015f1344ab8c21b82

commit_message:
Add Ceph Dashboard deployment section

This change adds the ceph dashboard deployment
section that describes how to trigger the
ceph ansible related playbooks via TripleO.

Change-Id: Ib56d76aa048188a58a5193f871ed9051f0581cd3

commit_message:
Remove _static folder in doc directory

TrivialFix:
_static folder and the inside files are auto generated
when running docs, _ga is unused, so remove these.

Change-Id: I43b8cff826a98329607eed65a75eaf1ebaf54646

commit_message:
Add response schema validation for volume hosts

This is to add response schema validation for volume
hosts, also to remove the fields check in testcases.
Besides, there are some inconsistencies in volume hosts api ref,
I36486724cc30389d371ec0b18b9b7f96883d193c will fix them.

Minor timing changes in an attempt to:

Change-Id: I4f64a2f5ab2d1696f244f083d5dc387c75cc1175

commit_message:
Adjust placement query for reserved nodes

Minor timing changes in an attempt to:
a) Make the logs less noisy
b) Wait a little bit longer for placement
   records to be updated.

Change-Id: I4f64a2f5ab2d1696f244f083d5dc387c75cc1175

incorrect match count.  And this fix will address the
issues and also support the retrieval of the matched
result set. So that anyone can understand that why the
alarm was raised and traceability etc.

Change-Id: Ib8d8a87be4e0526378aa04ccd8ff5631805adfeb

commit_message:
To enhance the nagios elasticsearch plugin

Fixes include types validation,index fields changes, counts
and adding meaningful details to the critical messages etc

Change-Id: Ib8d8a87be4e0526378aa04ccd8ff5631805adfeb

so, asically doing this in two steps'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-05 09:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-05 09:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-07-05 14:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-05 16:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from kayobe-in-kolla to project-update'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-05 16:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-06 00:13:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Is Kayobe something similar to TripleO?  That's what I feel like it is?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-06 10:36:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Is Kayobe something similar to TripleO?  That's what I feel like it
 > is?

It has a similar role, yes. It uses Kolla ansible for service deployment, and adds bare metal provisioning (via bifrost) and configuration of the control plane and compute hosts."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-07-08 10:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-07-09 12:39:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-07-10 00:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-07-11 10:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-07-11 11:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-15 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-08-27 19:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm sorry I didn't catch this sooner. It should have been added with the "x" namespace and then updated later after the rename, using a depends-on to the project-config change as OpenDev recommends. As things stand now, our governance refers to nonexistent repositories which are going to cause additional complication for election tooling.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-08-27 19:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I'm sorry I didn't catch this sooner. It should have been added
 > with the "x" namespace and then updated later after the rename,
 > using a depends-on to the project-config change as OpenDev
 > recommends. As things stand now, our governance refers to
 > nonexistent repositories which are going to cause additional
 > complication for election tooling.

Nevermind, I misread. They were added with the "x" namespace, so this is fine from an elections standpoint.'}]

commit_message:
Add HA Chassis Group related commands

This patch is introducing new commands to ovsdbapp to work with the new
HA_Chassis_Group and HA_Chassis tables in OVN Northbound database.

These tables were introduced by the commit [0] in core OVN which created
a new type of port called "external" that can be used for various things
including but not limited to: SR-IOV and baremetal booting support.

[0]
https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/b31c76000bef314b68e776d318d1ce4cf152450b

Change-Id: I77ad33223607bee63a96e548f308bbffc1c9de52
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

Hi Ifat and Anusha, thanks for the reviews!'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-04-03 04:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-05 18:25:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-05 20:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-09 18:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Hi all, thanks for the reviews and discussions. Based on the discussions here and on IRC/ML, I feel that it's a bit premature to finalized a generic push driver design. Instead, it could make more sense to implement specific push drivers for vitrage and monasca, then in the future use that experience and learning to design the generic driver.

Changing this spec to a WIP. I'm still eager to hear all thoughts and suggestions on the spec. Thank you all again."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-08-27 18:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Most functionality included here: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/congress-specs/specs/stein/json-data-model.html'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 07:20:04.000000000', 'message': 'Follow up for microversion 2.75

This is a follow-up for microversion 2.75 -
Multiple API cleanup changes.

The base class of the TestFlavorNovaClientV274 class is
the TenantTestBase class.
And the base class of the TenantTestBase class is
the ClientTestBase class.
It is not necessary to use the TenantTestBase class
as the base class. So specify the ClientTestBase class
directly.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I2cb971f46ba697d9386ca61b7f51169f02b605ab
'}]
commit_message:
Follow up for microversion 2.75

This is a follow-up for microversion 2.75 -
Multiple API cleanup changes.

The base class of the TestFlavorNovaClientV274 class is
the TenantTestBase class.
And the base class of the TenantTestBase class is
the ClientTestBase class.
It is not necessary to use the TenantTestBase class
as the base class. So specify the ClientTestBase class
directly.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I2cb971f46ba697d9386ca61b7f51169f02b605ab

[{'created': '2019-08-22 08:28:15.000000000', 'message': "Update packages in virtualenvs

Kayobe uses a number of virtual environments on the remote hosts for
python dependencies such as shade, python-openstackclient, docker, etc.
By default these are stored in /opt/kayobe/venvs/. Typically we do not
provide version restrictions when installing these packages, so over the
course of time they may become stale and incompatible.

This change installs the latest version of packages allowed by OpenStack
upper constraints.

It also adds a new variable, 'pip_upper_constraints_file', to set the

'kolla_upper_constraints_file' now defaults to the value of

Change-Id: I8d2956f95bbc44b5a9e88e7569372048a62f12f5

commit_message:
Update packages in virtualenvs

Kayobe uses a number of virtual environments on the remote hosts for
python dependencies such as shade, python-openstackclient, docker, etc.
By default these are stored in /opt/kayobe/venvs/. Typically we do not
provide version restrictions when installing these packages, so over the
course of time they may become stale and incompatible.

This change installs the latest version of packages allowed by OpenStack
upper constraints.

It also adds a new variable, 'pip_upper_constraints_file', to set the
upper constraints file. The existing variable
'kolla_upper_constraints_file' now defaults to the value of
'pip_upper_constraints_file'.

Change-Id: I8d2956f95bbc44b5a9e88e7569372048a62f12f5
Story: 2005923
Task: 34193
(cherry picked from commit ddfd6b6202a2a97d7e0d3372624f959b922828b1)

commit_message:
Ensure Barbican required roles are created by Keystone

Presently there are several roles: audit, observer, and key-manger:
service-admin that are used in Barbican policy but not generated
by Keystone during a TripleO Deployment.

This change updates Keystone's manifest to include creation of these
missing roles then the Barbican API is included as part of a depl-
oyment.

Change-Id: I6d5d0a37abeb54600bb70e22fabde9479320ab81
(cherry picked from commit 970462b56257bccc7671dfc770b3301eaf3acb58)
(cherry picked from commit 555498ba8c8edebc523b57b766738229abc8d16a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 17:54:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c

commit_message:
Use SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH in docs to make build reproducible

Set copyright year and html_last_updated_fmt to SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH if
it's set. See https://reproducible-builds.org/specs/source-date-epoch/

This patch make build reproducible, see https://reproducible-builds.org/

Change-Id: I730a8265ca2c70c639ef77a613908e84eb738b70

silent ignore of the endpoint_type option in the placement section.

[{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-08-22 14:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-08-22 15:19:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Giulio, did this [1] wasn't enough to move the firewall boolean on tripleo-ansible (for master)?

We then did this review [2] for stein because tripleo-ansible is not used there

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673470/4/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-ceph-common/defaults/main.yml

[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673894/1/deployment/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-08-22 15:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

right better not merge this until we resolve the issue discussed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673482/ and get that merged'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-08-22 15:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

So, according to the last comment in tripleo-ansible right now we're just able to collect all the variables (in the tripleo-common role) that are related to the "calling ansible" role: we're not able to pass these variables to ceph ansible so I think this review is needed to apply that boolean.
 
For instance here [1] I can't find that boolean (it's a scenario001 master execution), but in stein (were we've already added this change [2]) we can see the boolean in the ci logs [3].

I think this review is necessary and we also need to backport the change in rocky/queens, right?


[1] https://12942841482e92c0cd55-0acfe5e696fda6aec28b6c718c3c4841.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/674556/13/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/d957dce/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/undercloud-ansible-sJqhxi/ceph-ansible/group_vars/all.yml.txt.gz

[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673894/1/deployment/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml

[3] https://logs.opendev.org/94/673894/1/gate/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/5e68d72/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/undercloud-ansible-nHhqOs/ceph-ansible/group_vars/all.yml.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-08-22 15:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Adds configure_firewall into Ceph profiles

This must be set to false to prevent ceph-ansible from modifying
the firewall rules on the host.

Also updates some ceph_docker_* params now moved in ceph-ansible
to ceph_container_*

Change-Id: Ie29c662b77cf60fc6ac7361d841c592066a1d5c1

commit_message:
Override OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_CEPH for each chart

Currently OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_CEPH is calculated for ceph-mon only and
the same value is used for other charts from loop.

Change-Id: Ia014310ab675e4f58c224aae1139dfb3a065766b

commit_message:
Filter placement API endpoint by type too

The change introduced by I7e8c0e3ef7aefd0574aa2a28560653005f2640d6 is
silently ignore the endpoint_type option so we need to use filter.

Related-Bug: #1818943
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-07 13:59:47.000000000', 'message': 'Install selinux shim from pypi

Instead of symlinking the selinux library from the system into the
virtualenv it will install the selinux shim library from pypi which
is detecting the library location and loading it.

This approach is more flexible as it would not break on system updates.

In fact the selinux shim library can also be installed at system
level without affecting the use of selinux imports.

Change-Id: I92e0f3a5f2117021beb060627700d9d4339c172f
'}]
commit_message:
Install selinux shim from pypi

Instead of symlinking the selinux library from the system into the
virtualenv it will install the selinux shim library from pypi which
is detecting the library location and loading it.

This approach is more flexible as it would not break on system updates.

In fact the selinux shim library can also be installed at system
level without affecting the use of selinux imports.

Change-Id: I92e0f3a5f2117021beb060627700d9d4339c172f

[{'created': '2019-08-27 09:26:07.000000000', 'message': 'Pass tripleo-admin user for updates/upgrades in Queens.

fs037 and fs051, use config-download when running Queens jobs. The
config-download deployment uses tripleo-admin user for the ansible
execution, however we had hardcoded the zuul user (as Rocky, Stein
and master do use config-download by default). As a consequence, to
have the Queens jobs which use these featuresets working, we need
to specify the use of the overcloud-ssh-user to tripleo-admin.

Change-Id: I475c7c805fdcaa90b9b0183135d81f10faba3b8d
Closes-Bug: #1840763
'}]
commit_message:
Pass tripleo-admin user for updates/upgrades in Queens.

fs037 and fs051, use config-download when running Queens jobs. The
config-download deployment uses tripleo-admin user for the ansible
execution, however we had hardcoded the zuul user (as Rocky, Stein
and master do use config-download by default). As a consequence, to
have the Queens jobs which use these featuresets working, we need
to specify the use of the overcloud-ssh-user to tripleo-admin.

Change-Id: I475c7c805fdcaa90b9b0183135d81f10faba3b8d
Closes-Bug: #1840763

[{'created': '2019-08-21 06:42:35.000000000', 'message': "Ensure to python3 as basepython in all tox envs

There are some remaining tox envs with python2.7.
This commit ensures to specify python3 as basepython
for all meaningful tox environments.

Note that fullstack job is broken now due to unrelated reason(s)
and it will be fixed separately, so do not mind the test result.

Another note is the functional job is not run in the gate.
It seems because the functional job has only migration tests
and it is covered by 'check_migration' in the pep8 job.

commit_message:
Ensure to python3 as basepython in all tox envs

There are some remaining tox envs with python2.7.
This commit ensures to specify python3 as basepython
for all meaningful tox environments.

Note that fullstack job is broken now due to unrelated reason(s)
and it will be fixed separately, so do not mind the test result.

Another note is the functional job is not run in the gate.
It seems because the functional job has only migration tests
and it is covered by 'check_migration' in the pep8 job.
Anyway it is nice to run the functional job with python3.

Change-Id: I7c094940c6bde13ec91ac0f36bc9303ce46bad29

commit_message:
Fix fullstack job

stack_base and dstat gate hooks were deleted from neutron.
This commit recovers them in netwokring-bagpipe repo.

I believe it is a good idea to make the fullstack job work again
before converting it into zuulv3 (plus python3 support).

Change-Id: I5e1791334c7d1b2cf1386ffbcd2d57b2d0f14355

commit_message:
Change trace pod/pool drivers are incompatible

In current behaviour when pool driver for pod driver was
chosen incorrectly, kuryr-k8s-controller stops working,
but log message just says that it will be skipped. Also
not so clear which pool/pod driver leads to such situation.

Change-Id: I1a467117414d6fcfc15454144a2d7370d228c33b
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-07-31 15:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Looks good.  So is the implication that the service host has to be the same host for email notification as well?'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-01 08:00:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Looks good.  So is the implication that the service host has to be
 > the same host for email notification as well?

No, we don't define any notification methods in DevStack.
Are you referring to the change in `devstack/lib/notification.sh`? This specifies only where notification engine expects to find Kafka. DATABASE_HOST is set to localhost whereas SERVICE_HOST is the actual IP address.
I think we should set SERVICE_HOST also in the context of IPv6 testing."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 10:19:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

I've noticed issues in notification engine not being able to produce messages to the new version of Kafka and throwing `FailedPayloadsError`. The last version still working with the legacy Kafka client seems to be Apache Kafka 2.0.1."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 10:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 11:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 11:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 13:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-06 13:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looks sensible to me, waiting for CI.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 13:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-06 13:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-06 14:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

This looks good. Just wondering did 2.3 work, or do you want to leave that until the next release?

https://kafka.apache.org/downloads#2.3.0'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-06 14:13:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> This looks good. Just wondering did 2.3 work, or do you want to
 > leave that until the next release?

Kafka 2.3 appeared to work at first but when testing notification engine I noticed that it fails to publish messages back to the message queue with this error in broker:

  org.apache.kafka.common.errors.InvalidRequestException: Error getting request for apiKey: PRODUCE, apiVersion: 0

As a result notification engine crashes with `FailedPayloadsError`.

I haven't figured out what's the difference between API (which publishes successfully) and notification engine."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-06 14:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I see. It seems sensible not to move the goal post at this stage.'}, {'account_id': 11934, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-08-14 12:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-08-14 12:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-08-20 08:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-08-27 13:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow+1

Let's push this forward. Thank you."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-27 14:21:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

recheck

Let's see if it happens again. I see a timeout which isn't obviously py3 related, but could be a symptom of a failure elsewhere: 'AssertionError: Failed test_create_metrics: timeout on waiting for metrics: at least one metric is needed. Current number of metrics = 0'"}]

commit_message:
Upgrade Apache Kafka to version 2.0.1

Upgrade Apache Kafka to current stable version 2.0.1.

Issues have been observed with legacy Kafka producer being used in
notification engine together with newer Kafka broker versions.

Following changes are included:

* Deprecated configuration option `advertised.host.name` is replaced
with `listeners`.
* Default `log4j.properties` is used.

Story: 2005624
Task: 30933
Change-Id: I898b511b2ab8f68e4850faab2098044cd3f94ee7

commit_message:
Fix the post job for tinyipa/coreos

The image_distro variable has to be initialized even when not actually
used, because run.yaml is one big bash script.

Change-Id: Id73931b29feaa73550d3cb4924f63e303a2fa145

commit_message:
Add place-held _static dir for Sphinx 2.2.0

Sphinx 2.2.0 gets upset when a directory it is configured for does
not exist.

The _static directory is only used for automatically generated
configuration and policy sample files.

Change-Id: I5ee07a2cb118e5c9b16aefee73c9274ecace1d44

commit_message:
Remove openSUSE 42.3 job

42.3 will not be maintained anymore and therefore
there is no reason to test it. We will remove 42.3 nodes from
OpenDev CI soon.

Change-Id: I06454d6eade42ddd76db059c2bb74438fe04f032

commit_message:
Bump ansible-lint to version 4

Update for newer ansible support.

Disable test 204, we do not want to enforce a max line limit.
Disable test 306 for pipefail.
Copying over the narrative from opendev/system-config for these.

Disable 701 - we do not use galaxy so far, so no need to warn about
missing galaxy_info in roles/submit-subunit-jobs/meta/main.yaml.

Disable 403, we do install latest pip in some cases.

Fix some missing spaces around {{ and }}.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/667698
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/675260
Change-Id: I982f20385889bb1d9721b18cca179e49e39b903a

commit_message:
Update ansible-lint to version 4

Update to new version to catch early some bugs and deprecations.

Disable test 204, we do not want to enforce a max line limit.
Disable test 306 for pipefail.
Copying over the narrative from opendev/system-config for these.

Add missing spaces around {{ and }} to silence warning.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/667698
Change-Id: Icab329d93bd2801dbf5ebfa768b2121f5347859c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 19:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'lxc: make use of filter python3 compatible

_detect_nbd_devices uses the filter
builtin internally to filter valid devices.

In python 2, filter returns a list. In python 3,
filter returns an iterable or generator function.
This change eagerly converts the result of calling filter
to a list to preserve the python 2 behaviour under python 3.

Closes-Bug: #1840068

Change-Id: I25616c5761ea625a15d725777ae58175651558f8
(cherry picked from commit fc9fb383c16ecb98b1b546f21e7fabb5f00a42ac)
'}]
commit_message:
lxc: make use of filter python3 compatible

_detect_nbd_devices uses the filter
builtin internally to filter valid devices.

In python 2, filter returns a list. In python 3,
filter returns an iterable or generator function.
This change eagerly converts the result of calling filter
to a list to preserve the python 2 behaviour under python 3.

Closes-Bug: #1840068

Change-Id: I25616c5761ea625a15d725777ae58175651558f8
(cherry picked from commit fc9fb383c16ecb98b1b546f21e7fabb5f00a42ac)

``layer-basic`` it is more clear for the causual reader

Remove redundant entries from ``wheelhouse.txt``.

Change-Id: I8ebc75746307caa05aad705160b5bd834010bb52

commit_message:
Rebuild for sync layer-openstack

Also explicitly set ``include_system_packages`` to False.

While that setting is now the a default we consume from
``layer-basic`` it is more clear for the causual reader
of the charm source code.

Remove redundant entries from ``wheelhouse.txt``.

Change-Id: I8ebc75746307caa05aad705160b5bd834010bb52

commit_message:
Swap special CI jobs from xenial to bionic

The neutron role currently tests a whole bunch of network setups
on xenial, which is no longer supported for OSA since Rocky. Switch
these jobs over to bionic

Conflicts: zuul.d/jobs.yml
           zuul.d/project.yml

Change-Id: I37d4bb79f4441932008a0f43c4ab3dead5fc96d6
(cherry picked from commit d6ba36d85ba6f50bc5609639b8247b56e41d009a)

commit_message:
Avoid "utcnow" call clash in "test_update_timpestamp"

The function "uctnow" can be called during the execution of the test
"test_update_timpestamp". To avoid counting other tests calls to this
function, a retesting method is implemented for each check done.

Closes-Bug: #1841183

Change-Id: I2b75bb69feb65ca15fa448362baf2cc47fd42126

commit_message:
Add definition of OVN job for ubuntu xenial on rocky branch.

This is in preparation of moving the stein branch tests from xenial to
bionic. The stein branch jobs currently rely on the job definitions in
the rocky branch and this is hard to track and error prone when the
jobs on newer branches are adjusted in the future.

Change-Id: I60b4ce15ca26c6d3b673073920800ea53293634a

There are three options for responding: 

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1

commit_message:
Change blazar-dashboard release model

Since blazar-dashboard was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle. 

There are three options for responding: 

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1 
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.


Change-Id: I0de7585358b636d4ad8b08d6f0063c5128ebe88d

commit_message:
Revert "Handle defined containers that are stopped."

The proposed solution breaks pacemaker-managed containers,
see bz#1745950.

FWIW this only fix a corner case where the operators stopped the containers and want to run a tripleo operation
e.g. major upgrade.

We are proposing a revert to unblock downstream and
we'll have to rework this patch.

Revert in master here:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678855

This reverts commit 3c4d6a2382c982e917d9e6aff1c074e2893ccbb4.

Change-Id: I7c57f597672186dba279b64c8e8b9ee655b86103

commit_message:
Handle defined containers that are stopped.

Delete the stopped container and recreate it to ensure
there are no local modifications to the container.

Change-Id: Ia3fe06dd221d0894a5de2c18beaa48ba29440003
Resolves: rhbz#1674517
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef)

commit_message:
Count cni DEL failure as well to mark it unhealthy

We only count cni add failure to mark cni healthy. We should
also count del failures. We ignore the case when the annotations
is absent and del fails.

Change-Id: I8620986c12f7c6f5367e8ce3d74a68cbc0a8e2d7
Signed-off-by: Nayan Deshmukh <n.deshmukh@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Drop openSUSE 42.3 job

42.3 will not be maintained anymore and therefore
there is no reason to test it. Users are advised
to upgrade to Leap 15, and we should do the same.

Remove openSUSE 42.3 so that we can remove it from CI.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677947
Change-Id: Ie5a28bea3dee410dc7a05b1fc0bccf5b69c9415f

commit_message:
[Configuration] Switch to stestr.

According to OpenStack summit session, stestr is maintained project to
which all OpenStack projects should migrate.

Change-Id: I4532d02c7298b4e9e19ef079cfb1a365d4d56693

commit_message:
Add support for POST /v2/dataframes API endpoint to the client

Support for the ``/v2/dataframes`` endpoint has been added to the client.
A new ``dataframes add`` CLI command is also available.

Change-Id: I7fe9072d7280f251edc865a653a0b9ed2ab26c90
Story: 2005890
Task: 35970

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 08:27:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix MariaDB staged upgrade

This patch fixes 2 issues on MariaDB staged upgrade:

* After we landed service stopping on the data transfer step, the
  actual MariaDB staged upgrade moved from step 1 to step 2 of
  external_upgrade_tasks, but we only ran steps 0 and 1 during the
  upgrade. Increase the number of steps to run step 2 as well.

* The mysql_upgrade container was being re-run on each upgrade-scaleup
  even on nodes where it already ran before and MariaDB was already
  running there, conflicting with the upgrade container. We fix this
  by only running the MariaDB upgrade if there's no MariaDB running
  yet on the particular node.

Change-Id: I2feba6c22cdf07ea6af406c5edd27f62ff285d87
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1841415
"}]
commit_message:
Fix MariaDB staged upgrade

This patch fixes 2 issues on MariaDB staged upgrade:

* After we landed service stopping on the data transfer step, the
  actual MariaDB staged upgrade moved from step 1 to step 2 of
  external_upgrade_tasks, but we only ran steps 0 and 1 during the
  upgrade. Increase the number of steps to run step 2 as well.

* The mysql_upgrade container was being re-run on each upgrade-scaleup
  even on nodes where it already ran before and MariaDB was already
  running there, conflicting with the upgrade container. We fix this
  by only running the MariaDB upgrade if there's no MariaDB running
  yet on the particular node.

Change-Id: I2feba6c22cdf07ea6af406c5edd27f62ff285d87
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1841415

subject: Add a single resize test to the smoke set
messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-08 15:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-09 01:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does anyone have a good definition of what makes a smoke test?  IMO I thought it would be the minimal amount of tests that make sure that the micro services and resources like  rabbitmq and database are configured and talking to everyone.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-09 08:43:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Does anyone have a good definition of what makes a smoke test?  IMO
 > I thought it would be the minimal amount of tests that make sure
 > that the micro services and resources like  rabbitmq and database
 > are configured and talking to everyone.
I found this definition in [1]:
The type='smoke' attribute is used to signify that a test is a so-called smoke test, which is a type of test that tests the most vital OpenStack functionality, like listing servers or flavors or creating volumes. The attribute should be sparingly applied to only the tests that sanity-check the most essential functionality of an OpenStack cloud.


Although it does not really help to decide if resize / migrate is an essential operation or not. In a cloud that needs to be ever upgraded some form of move operation is needed. I could enable a migrate test instead but resize and migrate is basically the same in the background except the fact that resize not just move the server but also changes the flavor of it. So resize give us a tiny bit of more coverage for the same price as migrate.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#smoke-attribute"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:26:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with gibi that move operations like cold migration are important for upgrades. Live migration is more important if you support it, and we have the nova-grenade-live-migration job to test live migration across mixed service version computes, but that doesn't test the resize/cold migrate flows at all, which is why this came up in the referenced nova change in the commit message (which would have otherwise broke resize/cold migration flows with a Stein level compute).

Smoke tests are also usually supposed to be pretty quick, and the one tagged here is relatively fast (results from 3 different jobs):

2019-08-08 20:33:53.253320 | primary | {1} tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm [34.904545s] ... ok

2019-08-08 20:34:03.091064 | primary | {1} tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm [23.687867s] ... ok

2019-08-08 20:56:23.292393 | primary | {1} tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm [31.236877s] ... ok

Alternatives to this would be if we can somehow run both smoke and a test_resize_server_confirm in a specific grenade job, like grenade-py3. That is maybe possible using the tempest_test_regex attribute in the zuul job config.

Another alternative might be to run test_resize_server_confirm explicitly in the nova-grenade-live-migration job, but then that job is no longer only doing live migration (though the nova-live-migration job has been doing evacuate testing for awhile as well, so maybe it's time we rename those jobs to nova-grenade-multinode and nova-multinode, respectively).

Note that this change won't cover reverting a resize/cold migration which was also potentially broken in the referenced nova change, so if we want resize+revert testing in a grenade job and want to avoid marking that as smoke as well, we should probably consider one of the alternatives above."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-15 07:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I agree with gibi that move operations like cold migration are
 > important for upgrades. Live migration is more important if you
 > support it, and we have the nova-grenade-live-migration job to test
 > live migration across mixed service version computes, but that
 > doesn't test the resize/cold migrate flows at all, which is why
 > this came up in the referenced nova change in the commit message
 > (which would have otherwise broke resize/cold migration flows with
 > a Stein level compute).
 > 
 > Smoke tests are also usually supposed to be pretty quick, and the
 > one tagged here is relatively fast (results from 3 different jobs):
 > 
 > 2019-08-08 20:33:53.253320 | primary | {1} tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm
 > [34.904545s] ... ok
 > 
 > 2019-08-08 20:34:03.091064 | primary | {1} tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm
 > [23.687867s] ... ok
 > 
 > 2019-08-08 20:56:23.292393 | primary | {1} tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm
 > [31.236877s] ... ok
 > 
 > Alternatives to this would be if we can somehow run both smoke and
 > a test_resize_server_confirm in a specific grenade job, like
 > grenade-py3. That is maybe possible using the tempest_test_regex
 > attribute in the zuul job config.

grenade-py3 isn't multinode. :/ So I guess test_resize_server_confirm would be skipped.

 > 
 > Another alternative might be to run test_resize_server_confirm
 > explicitly in the nova-grenade-live-migration job, but then that
 > job is no longer only doing live migration (though the
 > nova-live-migration job has been doing evacuate testing for awhile
 > as well, so maybe it's time we rename those jobs to
 > nova-grenade-multinode and nova-multinode, respectively).

If the currently proposed patch is a no-go, then I for me the renaming the nova-grenade-live-migration job to nova-grenade-multinode and adding these test explicitly there would the preferred choice. 

 > 
 > Note that this change won't cover reverting a resize/cold migration
 > which was also potentially broken in the referenced nova change, so
 > if we want resize+revert testing in a grenade job and want to avoid
 > marking that as smoke as well, we should probably consider one of
 > the alternatives above."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-16 02:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree that resize operation is not so basic operation and we should not make it smoke. many jobs (recent ipv6 job) run the smoke tests and many more might be running in gate as well as in production. This can affect them.

I will suggest to go for the solution of running required tests on job side via tox env or tempest regex.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-27 13:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon in favor of https://review.opendev.org/678841'}]

Add a single resize test to the smoke set

To cover resize and migrate RPC changes in nova with grenade this patch
tags test_resize_server_confirm with "smoke" as grenade runs the smoke
set. This come up with in the nova review [1].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655721/10

Change-Id: I8a3e11c606c21490462b6f3e4bad71c39a5e63bc

commit_message:
Add tests for domain users interacting with policies

This commit introduces some tests that show how domain users are
expected to behave with the policies API. A subsequent
patches will -

 - add project user test coverage
 - add functionality for system reader for policy association
 - add functionality for system member for policy association
 - add functionality for system admin for policy association
 - domains user test coverage for policy association
 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file

Change-Id: I44b0553cc9c590cb4d5ec5d037a17e4ea9cb8667
Partial-Bug: #1805409

commit_message:
Implement system admin for policies

This change modifies the policies for policies
API to be more self-service by properly checking for
system scopes. It also includes the test cases.

Subsequent patches will -

 - domains user test coverage
 - project user test coverage
 - add functionality for system reader for policy association
 - add functionality for system member for policy association
 - add functionality for system admin for policy association
 - domains user test coverage for policy association
 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file

Change-Id: I7559159f81d78fe6d7d8917a2926f9e3073e7b81
Partial-Bug: #1805409

Check for CRITICAL, WARNING and ERROR log messages in CI

At the end of a CI run, check all log files.

commit_message:
Set default timeout to 60 seconds for docker stop

The previous default timeout was 10 seconds, which does not always
allow services enough time to shut down safely.

Change-Id: I54eff91567108a7e5d99f067829ae4a6900cd859

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 18:35:49.000000000', 'message': "Allow first address in an IPv6 subnet as valid unicast

When looking at the RFC [1], there's no mention that this can't be the
gateway address.  Permit it.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4291#section-2.6.1

Change-Id: I3f2905c2c4fca02406dfa3c801c166c14389ba41
Fixes-Bug: #1682094
(cherry picked from commit 1916bc5c0627ca24e312ca55ea62c8df7eb8f158)
(cherry picked from commit 0cd42257aaced0b6da0f43bc5da660b6a664141f)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow first address in an IPv6 subnet as valid unicast

When looking at the RFC [1], there's no mention that this can't be the
gateway address.  Permit it.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4291#section-2.6.1

Change-Id: I3f2905c2c4fca02406dfa3c801c166c14389ba41
Fixes-Bug: #1682094
(cherry picked from commit 1916bc5c0627ca24e312ca55ea62c8df7eb8f158)
(cherry picked from commit 0cd42257aaced0b6da0f43bc5da660b6a664141f)

[{'created': '2019-08-23 15:38:01.000000000', 'message': '[blazar] Use database_address as default DB addr

The internal FQDN assumes that HAProxy is set up to route traffic to the

Change-Id: I9a333a89adfa4f620f211c831d659b8d52e307d5

commit_message:
[blazar] Use database_address as default DB addr

The internal FQDN assumes that HAProxy is set up to route traffic to the
DB; other services default to the value of database_address.

Change-Id: I9a333a89adfa4f620f211c831d659b8d52e307d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 16:36:10.000000000', 'message': "Add tags always into external update tasks.

After bumping the Ansible version in Tripleo to 2.6, it was needed
to perform a change in the include module into include_tasks or
import_tasks, as include was getting deprecated [0]. The external
update/upgrades tasks got impacted by that change, but as they use
a loop to execute the tasks we couldn't use import_tasks.
The way include_tasks handles the tasks execution depending on the
tags differs from import_tasks (dynamic vs static) and as a consequence
when running the external upgrade run passing --tags container_image_prepare
we didn't see any tasks running. This behavior got fix in [1], which
seems to be the right way to preserve the import_tasks tags handling as
explained in [2]. But the external update tasks were missed to patch.

This patch includes the tags: always statement inside the external
update tasks and also syncs the variables content we pass into external_update_tasks
as many of those variables, which we do pass for the external_upgrade_playbook,
were missing in the external_update_playbook.

[0] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/579844/
[1] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639642/1
[2] - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/30882#issuecomment-380596557
Closes-Bug: #1839520
Change-Id: If7e7b4bbb3cead0887384cc543ce37e9ee5396ab
(cherry picked from commit 6c675af9babf475cbc825b437b37ff06de4b461b)
"}]
commit_message:
Add tags always into external update tasks.

After bumping the Ansible version in Tripleo to 2.6, it was needed
to perform a change in the include module into include_tasks or
import_tasks, as include was getting deprecated [0]. The external
update/upgrades tasks got impacted by that change, but as they use
a loop to execute the tasks we couldn't use import_tasks.
The way include_tasks handles the tasks execution depending on the
tags differs from import_tasks (dynamic vs static) and as a consequence
when running the external upgrade run passing --tags container_image_prepare
we didn't see any tasks running. This behavior got fix in [1], which
seems to be the right way to preserve the import_tasks tags handling as
explained in [2]. But the external update tasks were missed to patch.

This patch includes the tags: always statement inside the external
update tasks and also syncs the variables content we pass into external_update_tasks
as many of those variables, which we do pass for the external_upgrade_playbook,
were missing in the external_update_playbook.

[0] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/579844/
[1] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639642/1
[2] - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/30882#issuecomment-380596557
Closes-Bug: #1839520
Change-Id: If7e7b4bbb3cead0887384cc543ce37e9ee5396ab
(cherry picked from commit 6c675af9babf475cbc825b437b37ff06de4b461b)

commit_message:
Remove invalid reference to Placement API

The Placement API has moved out of the Nova role and is no
longer defined in `nova_services`.

Change-Id: I7b9601334c7e4c6b075a233557669ad414556e09

commit_message:
Remove incorrect job definitions

Currently the project.yaml contains ovn testing.

This is a problem because:
- The feature was only introduced in stein
- This is voting in gates.

These two jobs were mistakenly introduced while backporting.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I8fe687c65443fcaaf0f2344e2dc4deda716209cb

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for networking-baremetal

Removes a check from vif_details which is pointless
as we do not utilize that field from neutron. The field's
contents changed in neutron during the train cycle, and now
have contents, but because this ML2 plugin is post-execution
we don't need to worry about it.

Change-Id: I81852801955e5617b6ad6cbb396a194f258e39b3

commit_message:
[Queens] Add overcloud_ssh_user in minor update prepare.

When running the minor update overcloud update prepare step,
it should be possible to pass the overcloud-ssh-user. However, this
has been skipped for the minor update templates in Queens (while
present on the upgrade prepare template).

Change-Id: Ie2398bb6a54dfe031c6ed58bd50792a131023241
Closes-Bug: #1840763

commit_message:
watcher: add systemd units for watcher services

Currently systemd unit for watcher componenets are missing making it
difficult to manage the lifecycle of these services.
So adding these unit files and be installed during installation.

Also a minor tweak to the permission of the service folder under
sysconf dir to enable reading of the service config files for
these processes.

Change-Id: Id35d7e39429bdf13be95d414481ec6eaf7fce874

The vlan network provider, requires a physical network type, otherwise,
it will fail

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 11:04:02.000000000', 'message': 'Parametrize UpgradeLeappDevelSkip to pass multiple env variables.

One of the ways Leapp has to skip some checks is by
passing some environment files when to the leapp
execution environment. Up to now we only tested the
LEAPP_DEVEL_SKIP_RHSM=1 one, however there are many
more. So it makes sense to parametrize this variable
to allow passing a string with all the environment
variables we want to pass to Leapp.

Change-Id: Ic9f4a36cef25150708a71396bea754a93f87661d
'}]
commit_message:
Parametrize UpgradeLeappDevelSkip to pass multiple env variables.

One of the ways Leapp has to skip some checks is by
passing some environment files when to the leapp
execution environment. Up to now we only tested the
LEAPP_DEVEL_SKIP_RHSM=1 one, however there are many
more. So it makes sense to parametrize this variable
to allow passing a string with all the environment
variables we want to pass to Leapp.

Change-Id: Ic9f4a36cef25150708a71396bea754a93f87661d

[{'created': '2019-08-27 07:59:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional test jobs for the v2 client

This adds test jobs for the v2 client, in python2 and python3.

Work items:

* Remove the "functional" tox environment and introduce the "functional-v1"
  and "functional-v2" environments.

* Add zuul base jobs for python2 and python 3 testing. Two jobs inherit from
  each of these new jobs: one for the v1 client and one for the v2 client.

* Add "OS_ENDPOINT" to the list of environment variables forwarded to the
  functional test environments in order to ease local testing.

Change-Id: I54a43a1e844e92730afbf87316b9efe73a08d850

* Add zuul base jobs for python2 and python 3 testing. Two jobs inherit from

Change-Id: I54a43a1e844e92730afbf87316b9efe73a08d850

commit_message:
Add functional test jobs for the v2 client

This adds test jobs for the v2 client, in python2 and python3.

Work items:

* Remove the "functional" tox environment and introduce the "functional-v1"
  and "functional-v2" environments.

* Add zuul base jobs for python2 and python 3 testing. Two jobs inherit from
  each of these new jobs: one for the v1 client and one for the v2 client.

* Add "OS_ENDPOINT" to the list of environment variables forwarded to the
  functional test environments in order to ease local testing.

Change-Id: I54a43a1e844e92730afbf87316b9efe73a08d850

This patchset removes the load-time mocking necessary due to load-time
function calls in 'constants'.  The constants are changed to run-time
functions and and the lazy feature of restart_on_change is used, and the
harden disable for unit testing is switched on when needed.

"}]
commit_message:
Remove load-time mocking from unit tests

This patchset removes the load-time mocking necessary due to load-time
function calls in 'constants'.  The constants are changed to run-time
functions and and the lazy feature of restart_on_change is used, and the
harden disable for unit testing is switched on when needed.

Change-Id: I73e719ed082a7c8f9c477fd82094532bdbb8029b

commit_message:
Generate etherpad links automatically

With this change, the ptgbot will generate links for each track
etherpad, display them on a specific page (etherpads.html) and
allow track moderators to override the autogenerated link using
the #track etherpad command.

It requires the database to contain an 'eventid' key which serves
as a unique etherpads prefix.

Change-Id: Iaa524530e9f2506369f180588a2b6f98f4cad3d1

commit_message:
Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

The oslosphinx package is not compatible with the current Sphinx 2.0.
This switches over to use the preferred and supported openstackdocstheme
instead.

Change-Id: I57128b0b8bf37711fd8215a9fb3a7f27b0ac4f96

commit_message:
ceph-base: Disable ceph-ansible firewall tasks

TripleO already manages firewall rules so we don't need to have both
enabled in the same time.
It's currently not an issue because the firewall rules aren't apply by
ceph-ansible on containerized deployment but it will be enabled soon.

Change-Id: I2b8fc3fcf757e5a24696f2d3575fe696b9cdfdf0
Co-Authored-By: Dimitri Savineau <dsavinea@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 954abc8e9b0920ef5cb7b0c997af3af0409d72b8)
(cherry picked from commit f4f2a900e711822f876a25a69a56624265591612)

commit_message:
Handle floppy disk controllers

Cleaning presently fails on floopy disk controllers.

While they may be uncommon in server hardware, they
can exist in virtual machines, and even as virtual
devices on some hardware chassises.

Change-Id: I8ba07bfd5ca1e503f46c1bac4fffb5f509186939
Story: 2006419
Task: 36309

commit_message:
Use promote job

Change doc publishing to a promote job so that we do not need to rebuild
docs in the post pipeline.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678351
Change-Id: I4c7d429030eb7388a5e9b8045a01ebaadc2ae911

subject: static-docs: use target from fileserver
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-27 05:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-27 05:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 05:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'static-docs: use target from fileserver

The "target_dir" fact is set only for localhost, so can't be
referenced below when running the synchronize on the fileserver.

fileserver.path and static_target should be set globally and can be
referenced in the synchronize step.  Move the master branch check
out and earlier.

Change-Id: Ie9f73df453abb7321950f12b34dcc911b950d630
'}]
commit_message:
static-docs: use target from fileserver

The "target_dir" fact is set only for localhost, so can't be
referenced below when running the synchronize on the fileserver.

fileserver.path and static_target should be set globally and can be
referenced in the synchronize step.  Move the master branch check
out and earlier.

Change-Id: Ie9f73df453abb7321950f12b34dcc911b950d630

subject: optional parameter should be passed only once
messages:
[{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-07-31 19:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:37:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

It doesn't make sense to fix this by restricting the behavior in the CLI -- it's reasonable to pass in multiple filters and the client should be able to handle that."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-08-01 14:52:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It doesn't make sense to fix this by restricting the behavior in
 > the CLI -- it's reasonable to pass in multiple filters and the
 > client should be able to handle that.

Thanks for the review Eric.
I have made these changes keeping in mind the following points :
* Some optional arguments when passed multiple times causes unexpected output Eg : cinder list --name X --name Y and cinder list --name Y --name X have ambiguous results and provides volume list for name=last argument passed (skips the first occourence)
* According to Gorka's comment on the bug, optional arguments that aren't ready to be accepted multiple times can be restricted (like positional args) rather than providing handler for each of them individually.

Maybe we can add handler for some specified arguments?
Correct me if i'm wrong anywhere."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-08-13 09:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This approach is pretty interesting, and may be the right way to go, but I think we also need something like AppendStore that can combine dict key/value pairs etc.  This would be needed to actually fix the bug I wrote (which this patch doesn't really do yet).

I also think we will need to, at least at first, do this only in the v2/v3 shells.  Adding checks like this to the v1 shell is bound to cause compatibility problems for users that have scripted against the cinder CLI."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-10-23 16:51:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This approach is pretty interesting, and may be the right way to
 > go, but I think we also need something like AppendStore that can
 > combine dict key/value pairs etc.  This would be needed to actually
 > fix the bug I wrote (which this patch doesn't really do yet).
 > 
 > I also think we will need to, at least at first, do this only in
 > the v2/v3 shells.  Adding checks like this to the v1 shell is bound
 > to cause compatibility problems for users that have scripted
 > against the cinder CLI.

Thanks for the suggestions Eric.
I think we would need a list of param with which the AppendStore will work (will restrict for the ambigous params)"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-05-03 16:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-05-03 16:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Will be updated per PTG discussion'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-08-27 05:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

New implementation
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678523/'}]

[{'created': '2018-07-31 19:46:45.000000000', 'message': "optional parameter should be passed only once

cinder CLI doesn't restrict using optional parameters
multiple times in a single command which can result in
unexpected output.
Eg : cinder list --sort name --sort id
adding custom action parameter to valid arguments
restricts the multiple usage of optional parameter

Change-Id: I1e024229234760be2892dc2aad65159a13e708d0
Closes-Bug: #1696780

commit_message:
optional parameter should be passed only once

cinder CLI doesn't restrict using optional parameters
multiple times in a single command which can result in
unexpected output.
Eg : cinder list --sort name --sort id
adding custom action parameter to valid arguments
restricts the multiple usage of optional parameter

Change-Id: I1e024229234760be2892dc2aad65159a13e708d0
Closes-Bug: #1696780

commit_message:
Make volume type optional

Without this patch, creating db instance will fail if no volume type is
provided:

  Validation error: instance['volume']['type'] None is not of type 'string' (HTTP 400)

even if `cinder_volume_type` is configured in trove config file.

Change-Id: I3487e45840f72875ffd6cfb6ca75b4bbf60ab51e

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30499, 'date': '2019-08-27 02:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-27 03:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2019-08-26 16:03:51.000000000', 'message': 'Accounts for Ubuntu paths on pip installation

On Ubuntu pip installs everything to /usr/local by default, including
putting DIB element to /usr/local/share, where we cannot find it.

commit_message:
Accounts for Ubuntu paths on pip installation

On Ubuntu pip installs everything to /usr/local by default, including
putting DIB element to /usr/local/share, where we cannot find it.
This changes add support for it and additionally improves error message.

Change-Id: I52e0abd7e69668f15ca7a02ad238a96b98eeaaf3

commit_message:
Remove hiera roles

The hiera roles have been moved into tripleo-ansible and are no longer
needed within this repository. This change removes the roles that have
been moved.

Because this change removes the last of the roles within this repo
the setup.cfg file has been modified to remove the no longer relevant
install path(s), the molecule related config has been pulled out of
the tox.ini file, and the molecule related packages have been purged
from the bindep.txt file.

Story: 2006044
Task: 34726
Story: 2006044
Task: 34730
Depends-On: I7f9e993735a0347aac12f728393639d88c80ff0f
Change-Id: I1bf74a4fb0adcae632c06b38e06a572ebc434201
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use the special user role 'service' as service token role

Since If3583ac08e33380f1c52ad50d7d5c74194393480 was merged,
we expect that we must assign a special role (service token role)
in a future release, for the users who use service token to bypass
token expiration check.

This patch introduces a new keystone role 'service', which is
used as a service token role, and makes it assigned to the users,
nova and cinder, who uses service token feature.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667251/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667252/
Change-Id: I3ce0796e0e95d4f8b2d24f21eaae205cf00a54a4

commit_message:
Add new role parameters for cpu/ram/disk allocation ratio

This change adds three new role parameters `NovaCPUAllocationRatio`,
`NovaRAMAllocationRatio` and `NovaDiskAllocationRatio` for
configuring cpu_allocation_ratio, ram_allocation_ratio and
disk_allocation_ratio.
The default values for CPU and Disk allocation ratio are taken
as 0.0 as it will be updated by update_available_resource method
as mentioned in [1].
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html

Change-Id: Ia3c62668b0c1469e31aa8cd2c984b460eb06d970

commit_message:
Add *_domain_name in authtoken configuration in Octavia

This patch makes sure that we configure user_domain_name and
project_domai_name in authtoken configuration in Octavia, as
we configure these options in the other services.

commit_message:
Move cephfs and cephfs_*_pool ceph-ansible parameters in -base

We have to move these into the -base service so they are dumped in
"all" ansible group vars and correctly consumed by nfs role
when not colocated with mds.

Closes-Bug: 1840651
Change-Id: I7aec1b80e0f598fc86720d669151958ca7b2e01d
(cherry picked from commit 04b1378ea1217db32aad4f03ad360da4c4df24dd)

commit_message:
Add LibvirtTLSPriority to set libvirtd tls_priority

Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time
default TLS priority string.
Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

Change-Id: Id05c5e88be2d9f90642ed5159cb2db03c997f83a
Closes-Bug: #1840447

commit_message:
Adds LibvirtLogFilters to define a libvirtd filter

LibvirtLogFilters to select a different logging level for a given
category log outputs, as specified in https://libvirt.org/logging.html .
Default:

'1:libvirt 1:qemu 1:conf 1:security 3:event 3:json 3:file 3:object 1:util'

Depends-On: Ic48afe856ae60654d6cebf627b12509881933c59
Change-Id: I85b09ddeb61b2f3563f81eb423e8f05b18fe984a
Closes-Bug: 1840140

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 23:58:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix download rc v3 file test

This PS fixes existing issue with test download
rc v3 file. This test was broken since earlier action locator
was generic and was downloading both version of openrc files
hence we will have both openrc file downloaded
in temp folder and always first one (v2) picked up
for test. So with this PS, corrected action locator per
rc version used by appropriate tests.

Change-Id: I026401a1f822015394f99af7fe7313a66ba8d440
'}]
commit_message:
Fix download rc v3 file test

This PS fixes existing issue with test download
rc v3 file. This test was broken since earlier action locator
was generic and was downloading both version of openrc files
hence we will have both openrc file downloaded
in temp folder and always first one (v2) picked up
for test. So with this PS, corrected action locator per
rc version used by appropriate tests.

Change-Id: I026401a1f822015394f99af7fe7313a66ba8d440

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 20:10:23.000000000', 'message': "Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)

commit_message:
Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 20:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
'}]
commit_message:
rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
