revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 19:47:02.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change I2cf2fcbaebc706f897ce5dfbff47d32117064f9c
is not in Stein this backport copies the _set_nodes method
for the FakeDriver to avoid having to use the set_nodes
and restore_nodes globals on the fake driver module.

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560
(cherry picked from commit 89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411)
"}, {'created': '2019-08-15 16:03:55.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change I2cf2fcbaebc706f897ce5dfbff47d32117064f9c
is not in Stein this backport needs to modify the test to use
the global set_nodes/restore_nodes which means we can remove some
of the startup hackery at the beginning of the test. Also, since
FakeDriver.set_nodes does not exist in Stein we have to modify the
FakeDriver._nodes variable directly (the global doesn't affect that
after startup).

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560
(cherry picked from commit 89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411)
"}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change I2cf2fcbaebc706f897ce5dfbff47d32117064f9c
is not in Stein this backport needs to modify the test to use
the global set_nodes/restore_nodes which means we can remove some
of the startup hackery at the beginning of the test. Also, since
FakeDriver.set_nodes does not exist in Stein we have to modify the
FakeDriver._nodes variable directly (the global doesn't affect that
after startup).

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560
(cherry picked from commit 89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411)

commit_message:
Skip the services with no endpoints when parsing service catalog

When parsing the service catalog to find the source, audit middleware
should skip over the services which have no endpoints instead of
assuming they will have at least one endpoint.

Change-Id: I287873e99338d95baaf20d52ecb3a43763a401fc
Closes-Bug: #1800017
(cherry picked from commit 6779838a242b222672721407cc320672ab24067a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 22:43:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update stable/queens upper constraints file location

Tox fails locally When running ``tox -e bandit`` due to a 302 redirect
pointing to the new location of the upper-constraints file, mainly due
to the migration to opendev.

This commit also constrains bandit to version 1.5.1 or earlier since
version 1.6.0 introduces some additional checks that fail on
false-positive naming (e.g., `token`).

Change-Id: Ie03e6970e0d45a3f066a87cdca8a6e1f98f51634
'}]
commit_message:
Update stable/queens upper constraints file location

Tox fails locally When running ``tox -e bandit`` due to a 302 redirect
pointing to the new location of the upper-constraints file, mainly due
to the migration to opendev.

This commit also constrains bandit to version 1.5.1 or earlier since
version 1.6.0 introduces some additional checks that fail on
false-positive naming (e.g., `token`).

Change-Id: Ie03e6970e0d45a3f066a87cdca8a6e1f98f51634

commit_message:
Add test for create server with integer AZ

While reviewing the AZ in unshelve request BP,
matt found that there is no test case for passing
the AZ as integer value in create server request.

- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663851/40

This commit adds the missing test case and make sure
code raise ValidationError.

Change-Id: I1cf628c490e8937e2e822957a1de173f02c69bbb

commit_message:
Allow reserve_node to backfill from existing node

Metalsmith works fine when the allocation record is missing for an
existing active node, but for nova-less upgrade cases it would be nice
if a proper allocation record can be created. This becomes possible by
exposing the allocation create node mechanism.

Change-Id: Ibaeb99f37a044bbffb3afab7d9511e35a3263ab0
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676521

commit_message:
Add settings from fs001 missing in fs035

fs035 should match fs001 - except for the ipv6-related
settings. This patch adds some settings recently added
to fs001 - not yet added to fs035.

Related-Bug: #1840616

commit_message:
Update stable/queens upper constraints file location

Tox fails locally When running ``tox -e bandit`` due to a 302 redirect
pointing to the new location of the upper-constraints file, mainly due
to the migration to opendev.

This commit also gets bandit passing on stable/queens by excluding a
couple of false positive bandit warnings.

Change-Id: I1b5295ffa906f2d2090a41c5d0d0b018e630246e

commit_message:
Add filter plugins path to the ansible.cfg

Custom filter plugins are required for certain roles (like
tripleo-ovs-dpdk), adding the path to the generated ansible.cfg
file.

Change-Id: Ic2144aac86df5498062a039562b79f01def7da49

subject: Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 19:05:11.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 7c9c363c789811d54353d769aab86774eb5c96f8)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 7c9c363c789811d54353d769aab86774eb5c96f8)

commit_message:
fake driver bug fix

1. rebase fake driver on master branch.
2. add new attach_type "TEST_PCI" in Cyborg DB.
3. Change PGPU device to FPGA device in order to avoid add new device
type in Cyborg DB.

Change-Id: I05c69f7b377a81637ff52e4b885107f6b455fce6

IMHO we do not need to add a new menu. Thought?'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2017-06-13 15:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It was my initial idea to also switch the protocol from ICMP to ICMPv6 automatically based on the CIDR, however, it occured to be that ICMPv6 is actually a completely separate protocol. I am not familiar with it enough to be able to tell if you ever would need ICMP with an IPv6 CIDR, or ICMPv6 with an IPv4 CIDR, but I figured that if they are indeed separate protocols, it makes sense to keep them separate. If you are confident that we can merge them the way you suggest, I am happy to do that.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2017-06-13 19:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-13 20:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

[{'created': '2017-06-12 14:28:58.000000000', 'message': 'Allow creating ICMPV6 rules

Right now, even if we specify a ::/0 (or other IPv6) CIDR in an
ICMP rule, Horizon sets the ip_protocol of that rule to ICMP and
not to ICMPV6, which results in that rule never matching anything.

This change modifies the default settings, adding an "All ICMPV6"
option to the SECURITY_GROUP_RULES defaults, making it possible
to create ICMPV6 security rules.

commit_message:
Allow creating ICMPV6 rules

Right now, even if we specify a ::/0 (or other IPv6) CIDR in an
ICMP rule, Horizon sets 'icmp' as the ip_protocol of that rule but
neutron expects 'ipv6-icmp' which is the right ip_protocol for ICMPv6.
This results in that rule never matching anything.

This change makes Horizon set the ip_protocol to ipv6-icmp when
the CIDR is an IPv6 one, and icmp when it's IPv4.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1f68e1e5a3e073e38ac258de5ed9c43f8acb04e9
Closes-Bug: #1652619

commit_message:
Redis metadata using incorrect network/service

Metadata was set to use mysql network and service[1]. This resulted
in Redis service principles never being generated for TLS-E deplo-
yments.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674369/

Change-Id: I55fecf3c7d02342b28570c1ad75edc927afa19ce
Partial-bug: #1838679
(cherry picked from commit 6a514fb14371c088240bcb83615a15dd78f1a9fb)

install specific packages prior to the kmod execution.

kmod loading.

(cherry picked from commit cf8dc4658a4dbbffc145c24898be280ca47d902e)

Contrail Nova VIF plugin relies on Nova (core) code to create a tap

to be able to access /dev/net/tun which it cannot with the current
apparmor profile when enforcing mode is enabled.

commit_message:
Allow nova-compute rw access to /dev/net/tun

Contrail Nova VIF plugin relies on Nova (core) code to create a tap
interface before a vrouter interface is plugged. Thus nova-compute needs
to be able to access /dev/net/tun which it cannot with the current
apparmor profile when enforcing mode is enabled.

See LP: #1841111

Change-Id: I31033bc7d95dfce6b677c6e948303f7154395f66
Closes-Bug: #1841111
(cherry picked from commit 4168ffd5362153a7dacd5745b0a982ea695bf349)

commit_message:
Rebuild for sync layer-openstack

Also explicitly set ``include_system_packages`` to False.

While that setting is now the a default we consume from
``layer-basic`` it is more clear for the causual reader
of the charm source code.

Add some missing dependencies.

Drop Trusty support as one of the downstream dependencies
(``cmd2``) have dropped Python 3.4 support.

Change-Id: I05de745fac2f0685fddebb8709b7226a2f6617ad

commit_message:
Kill all processes running in a namespace before deletion

In "NamespaceFixture", before deleting the namespace, this patch
introduces a check to first kill all processes running on it.

Closes-Bug: #1838793

Change-Id: I27f3db33f2e7ab685523fd2d6922177d7c9cb71b

In the no-namespace test cases, sometimes the interfaces to be created
exist in the kernel namespace. To avoid this possible problem, we first

commit_message:
Force deletion of interfaces to create in "FdbInterfaceTestCase"

In the no-namespace test cases, sometimes the interfaces to be created
exist in the kernel namespace. To avoid this possible problem, we first
force the deletion of those interfaces.

Change-Id: I9eba21d872263665481303fbab1ee3ec9bdaa044
Closes-Bug: #1841253

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests.

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev_bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate_bundles.

Other minor adds:
- Changing naming convention for vip: 'Amulet' is deprecated.
- Passing OS env vars

LP Related-Bug: #1823719
Change-Id: I787248ad2983858c6db2e5a838270a128dae717a

commit_message:
Implement system reader and member for policies

This change modifies the policies for policies
API to be more self-service by properly checking for
system scopes. It also includes the test cases.

Subsequent patches will -

 - add functionality for system admin
 - domains user test coverage
 - project user test coverage
 - add functionality for system reader for policy association
 - add functionality for system member for policy association
 - add functionality for system admin for policy association
 - domains user test coverage for policy association
 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file

Change-Id: Ie696616aa594025ba83d6f70ce98e4b48e20b5df
Partial-Bug: #1805409

commit_message:
migration: Use python3 packages when needed

The patch changes names of installed packages by yum module based on
what Python version of interpreter is available on given node.

Closes-bug: #1839834

Change-Id: I5a2409d80ebd19904909bd62fb7c11ae0cbfde30
(cherry picked from commit 985f3805da9bed6477aa462f74d37c746c9bc2c6)

commit_message:
Capture console logs from failed server create

In the cinder resource creation we have been timing out ssh connection
tests to the test server. Unfortunately all of the existing logs I can
find indicate that this server is fine. Lets dump the console log to see
if that gives us any more info when ssh connectivity times out.

Change-Id: Ife397941deab80658fff375846a690a46a0c8b02
(cherry picked from commit 1fa49abbc8ebe220b9d53eec25f071817c644754)

commit_message:
[DNM] Increase standard VM memory to 400

Both Dmitry Tantsur and I have noticed some odd console logs
seemingly indicating the VM halted during boot. Since we keep
seeing issues, lets see what happens.

Change-Id: I928b37a45bef6376902191bc8f86569e6f952522

 > and they had to pull it. I'm realizing that if we set the
 > upper-constraints back to 1.3.4 that the bot may just set it back?
 > is there a way to !=1.35.?

Hi there, it seems it is affecting neutron builds of Kolla images: https://db08fb4b670c9643c64e-0b8936c820696cdb6c8467dc1e642b32.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/675614/30/check/kolla-ansible-centos-source/7a356b8/primary/logs/build/000_FAILED_neutron-base.log

What's the plan to fix it? 1.3.6 is not out yet."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-26 10:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

just fix the master, please :-)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-26 10:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

But used as dep of dep in neutron.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-26 10:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Update SDK fixture for openstacksdk 0.35.0

Version 0.35.0 of openstacksdk moved a get_endpoint call out from
_make_proxy, rebreaking all our tests that don't care about SDK adapters
beyend default mocking.

This commit stubs out that get_endpoint call.

We get to stop doing this soon, I promise.

Change-Id: I18b13609768d557f2db3b5ab70d913494933dc43

[{'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-07-26 00:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-07-29 05:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28618, 'date': '2019-07-29 14:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Why move configuration values to an environment variable? To me, it makes more sense to leave these in values.yaml.'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-07-29 20:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-07-29 20:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28618, 'date': '2019-08-05 21:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-08-06 01:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-08-07 18:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

Drew, thank you. Updated.
Tin, thank you for the review. The issue which I am fixing appears when we are trying to use rgw_ks and rgw_s3 at the same time. In that case two containers will be created which using the same script but with different set of environment variables. And it leads to the failures in both of them, because in each case some variables are missed. Updated code (this PS) allows to disable the execution of the part of the script, which is not related to the particular test.'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-08-07 18:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-08-07 18:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-08-07 18:43:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the answer, didn't see the previous lines. LGTM until further review - will let other chime in"}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-08-07 19:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-08-08 02:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2019-08-08 17:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 08:23:38.000000000', 'message': "Unescape IPv6 addresses for ceph_nfs_bind_addr

Currently we end up with IPv6 addresses in ganesha.conf that
are encapsulated in brackets so the file isn't parsed correctly
and the ceph_nfs container fails to start.

Closes-bug: #1840983
Change-Id: I035f945df3ea0519ce8b62daa6d0b313e84a508c
(cherry picked from commit 0478cd8923f3ce23c700aa2efac7a8fe518ab2ea)
(cherry picked from commit a2cbb5044ed82f8e5c2628d2945c056e170819ae)
(cherry picked from commit 022baa43f6715d15c1f69f86ebb82697a1d852c7)
"}]
commit_message:
Unescape IPv6 addresses for ceph_nfs_bind_addr

Currently we end up with IPv6 addresses in ganesha.conf that
are encapsulated in brackets so the file isn't parsed correctly
and the ceph_nfs container fails to start.

Closes-bug: #1840983
Change-Id: I035f945df3ea0519ce8b62daa6d0b313e84a508c
(cherry picked from commit 0478cd8923f3ce23c700aa2efac7a8fe518ab2ea)
(cherry picked from commit a2cbb5044ed82f8e5c2628d2945c056e170819ae)
(cherry picked from commit 022baa43f6715d15c1f69f86ebb82697a1d852c7)

commit_message:
Add promote jobs for static site / releasenotes

Add new promote jobs for promoting jobs that publish to the static site
and for promoting releasenotes.
Update projects.yaml for this change and remove jobs that are updated.

The existing promote file does not work for static site, create a new
one.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/678430
Change-Id: I112745b70448cc3e6fec6e2932e4fe651f9174b0

[{'created': '2019-07-29 16:25:08.000000000', 'message': '[libvirt] Check if domain is persistent on cleanup

Check if the domain was already undefined by another operation during
cleanup in libvirt driver. Without this check the undefine operation

Change-Id: If3ef50589b65b75c652bc053babfcb610bc17807
'}]
commit_message:
[libvirt] Check if domain is persistent on cleanup

Check if the domain was already undefined by another operation during
cleanup in libvirt driver. Without this check the undefine operation
might fail, as transient domains can not be undefined.

Closes-Bug: 1838309
Change-Id: If3ef50589b65b75c652bc053babfcb610bc17807

commit_message:
Add untargeted folder for specs

It was discussed at the Cinder Mid-Cycle that we
needed something to do with approved specs that were
still relevant but not being worked.  The recommendation
was to add an untargeted folder like the one that Glance
uses.  This patch does this.

I also discovered that the last two sections in
the index page were not displaying due to
incorrect RST format.  This patch also fixes
that.

Change-Id: I3f909742501ab3a3f36ba9eee4ede0b814f76f2d

commit_message:
keystone: transform keystone_refresh into ansible

Convert the keystone_refresh (restart keystone) from a kolla/paunch
container into an Ansible task at step 4.

Change-Id: I393df79922627767319a70fba0793a3c92f7fa52

commit_message:
Fix LVM IPv6 target portals

The LVM driver is reporting incorrect target_portal and target_portals
entries for IPv6 with all the targets, as it is not enclosing the
address in square brackets making it impossible for iscsiadm in OS-Brick
to tell the port appart from the IP address.

This patch makes sure that IPv6 addresses in target_portal and
target_portals are properly formatted in the [IPv6_address]:port when
the IPv6_address does not already include the square brackets.

This fix affects all the targets: IET, LIO, TGT, CXT, and SCST.

Closes-Bug: #1696866
Change-Id: Ie7053c813af8c99b5545222d4724b71061348a09

commit_message:
Add --migration-type and --source-compute to migration-list

The GET /os-migrations API take a migration_type and source_compute
filter parameter on the request since the v2.0 API. This adds support
for specifying those parameters in the "nova migration-list" CLI
and related MigrationManager.list() python API binding methods.

A functional test is added which will cover the new options on all
three of the decorated do_migration_list shell methods with lower
bounds on 2.1, 2.59 and 2.66. Since the only type of migration we
can safely generate in a single-node CI job is a resize the test
does a resize. As such, _pick_alternate_flavor is moved into the
base test class for re-use.

Implements blueprint more-migration-list-filters

Change-Id: I4be9a06df3e0d40d3990d067ce112247a81b45b4

commit_message:
CI: do not install IPA-builder as editable

We need to be able to find the DIB element in /usr/share, using editable
installation will prevent it.

Change-Id: I99e4b874e8429fc559a3fbfa22a6c5359e0ea081

commit_message:
Fix provisioning_state after a failover of a listener in ERROR

After performing a successful failover of a listener in ERROR (i.e after
a certificate change), the provisioning_state of the listener is now set
to ACTIVE.

Story: 2006257
Task: 35873

Change-Id: I7cf8c154c875b09ae51f5d8ead8cba7cbba95045

This is part of blueprint transport-options
The blueprint link is [1]
Please follow the link [2] to use and test the feature.

1-
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/transport-options

commit_message:
Add the mandatory flag for direct send

With this feature, the server will raise and log a Message Undeliverable
exception. So it is possible to log immediately an error in case the
reply queue does not exist for some reason.

This is part of blueprint transport-options
The blueprint link is [1]
Please follow the link [2] to use and test the feature.

1-
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/transport-options
2- https://github.com/Gsantomaggio/rabbitmq-utils/
tree/master/openstack/mandatory_test

Change-Id: Iac7474c06ef425a2afe5bcd912e51510ba1c8fb3

commit_message:
Add lower-constraints job

create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iac8d78c191763121cc580c5cdb070b2673e39c99

commit_message:
Force DIB Python version on -py2 jobs

DIB automatically picks a Python version based on the distro and
version. For Ubuntu Bionic, that default is Python 3 which means the
amphora-agent does not run on Python 2 when it was expected to on -py2
jobs [1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/10/661310/8/check/ \
    octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-scenario/664a91b/controller/logs/dib-build/ \
    amphora-x64-haproxy.qcow2_log.txt.gz#_2019-07-27_15_51_58_393

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673181/

Change-Id: I4184fdfb282de4eec2f1e6529edd3bed70977f45

commit_message:
Add DIB_PYTHON_VERSION to override Python version

The dib-python DIB element automatically picks the default Python
version for each distro. This patch allows Devstack users to override
the Python version the amphora-agent will run on.

Change-Id: I349f2c0ea7498474209d9d38218184ca115dde75

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-27 22:45:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix L7 repository create methods

SQLAlchemy can get confused if the parent database objects are not
linked when creating new records using the repository.
For example, when creating an L7 policy, even if you specify the
listener_id, sqlalchemy will drop the ID from the final SQL INSERT
parameter.
This patch corrects the L7 policy and rule create methods to have
the required parent objects linked.

Change-Id: I4380605bdb346eee824b2ce05fa25175c4cc3034
'}, {'created': '2019-07-29 20:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix L7 repository create methods

SQLAlchemy can get confused if the parent database objects are not
linked when creating new records using the repository.
For example, when creating an L7 policy, even if you specify the
listener_id, sqlalchemy will drop the ID from the final SQL INSERT
parameter.

commit_message:
Fix L7 repository create methods

SQLAlchemy can get confused if the parent database objects are not
linked when creating new records using the repository.
For example, when creating an L7 policy, even if you specify the
listener_id, sqlalchemy will drop the ID from the final SQL INSERT
parameter.
This patch corrects the L7 policy and rule create methods to have
the required parent objects linked.

Story: 2006305
Task: 36021

Change-Id: I4380605bdb346eee824b2ce05fa25175c4cc3034

commit_message:
Use the infra pypi mirror for DIB

This patch changes the devstack plugin to use the infra pypi
mirror if one is declared in the environment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/675468

commit_message:
Fix flavor profile API handling of None updates

The current flavor profile API does not properly handle
clearing/reseting values on update. Some mandatory fields would
return a database "cannot be Null" error. This patch raises the
proper invalid option execption.

Story: 2005374
Task: 33542

Change-Id: I5253c48871a8bb3bf91f82aa7791585cc4a6d529

commit_message:
neutron: Cleanup spec

- name services openstack-neutron-$service to be consistent with other
  projects. An systemd alias to the previous name is provided
- Split the different agents into subpackages (eg. dhcp-agent,
  l3-agent, ...)
- Rename linuxbridge & openvswitch to linuxbridge-agent and
  openvswitch-agent to be consistent with the other agent packages
- Fix config-dirs for the different services
- Add different cleanup services

Change-Id: Ib2650962abbaff9f39745c6456b1fb75f6b56146

commit_message:
Add openstack-placement rule for SUSE and RDO

The pypi name for OpenStack Placement is openstack-placement. This
name must not be translated (so the result is openstack-placement).

Change-Id: Ic47a0a5b66f23d0fb37364d79e7a61a9e6dcca8a

commit_message:
Fix l7rule API handling of None updates

The current l7rule API does not properly handle
clearing/reseting values on update.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the l7rule parameters.

Story: 2005374
Task: 36023

Change-Id: I4e8007ff98f585ce6622f7128ecdd53cdfa926a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 16:09:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add warning log if auth_strategy is not keystone

A user came to the IRC channel with CLI errors:
"Client-side error: Validation failure: Missing project ID in
request where one is required."

The root cause was the [api_settings] auth_strategy was set to
"noauth" instead of "keystone".

This patch adds a warning log message to the API process that
warns users that typically the auth_strategy should be set to
keystone.

Change-Id: I7793d7a9113b23ac88e7c53d5dc292a70b9453b5
'}, {'created': '2019-07-11 16:15:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add warning log if auth_strategy is not keystone

A user came to the IRC channel with CLI errors:
"Client-side error: Validation failure: Missing project ID in
request where one is required."

The root cause was the [api_settings] auth_strategy was set to
"noauth" instead of "keystone".

This patch adds a warning log message to the API process that
warns users that typically the auth_strategy should be set to
keystone.
It also points the user to have an administrator check the keystone
settings in the octavia.conf.

Change-Id: I7793d7a9113b23ac88e7c53d5dc292a70b9453b5
'}]
commit_message:
Add warning log if auth_strategy is not keystone

A user came to the IRC channel with CLI errors:
"Client-side error: Validation failure: Missing project ID in
request where one is required."

The root cause was the [api_settings] auth_strategy was set to
"noauth" instead of "keystone".

This patch adds a warning log message to the API process that
warns users that typically the auth_strategy should be set to
keystone.
It also points the user to have an administrator check the keystone
settings in the octavia.conf.

Change-Id: I7793d7a9113b23ac88e7c53d5dc292a70b9453b5

commit_message:
Increase overcloud deploy timeout to 110

During overcloud deploy, while writting the config_step
hieradata for the deploy, it pulls containers from Docker
registry. Sometimes, container takes more than 10 mins
leading to cosuming the whole time defined for deploy
timedout, which further leads to ansible timeout.

Increasing deploy timeout temporarily fixes the issue.

Related-Bug: #1840616

Change-Id: I596564353efbee20a29ffd591d1fa273bf95ccf2
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Export ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH in tripleo-ci log collection

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678072/ in tripleo-ansible override
the ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH leading to failure in discovering oooq
roles and post log-collection in CI failes.

Explicitly exporting the same fixes the issue.

Related-Bug: #1841405

Change-Id: Id5df311417610257da04b48b3b8d83000e67aef9
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

tags for all TripleO projects.

commit_message:
Ensure Barbican required roles are created by Keystone

Presently there are several roles: audit, observer, and key-manger:
service-admin that are used in Barbican policy but not generated
by Keystone during a TripleO Deployment.

This change updates Keystone's manifest to include creation of these
missing roles then the Barbican API is included as part of a depl-
oyment.

Change-Id: I6d5d0a37abeb54600bb70e22fabde9479320ab81
(cherry picked from commit 970462b56257bccc7671dfc770b3301eaf3acb58)

commit_message:
Add lower-constraints job

create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iae676c4bbd00836cc6dce0f083f7aa308bbfc372

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 11:00:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mismatching fixed vs unique container names

Sometimes, like when redeploying in-place, containers for the "fixed"
service name might already existed, thus get the prefixed names. That
might create mismatches. For example the pidfile names may diverge by
the "fixzed" container service name vs its predictable prefixed unique
name.

Fix that by using the predictable unique names instead of the service
container names for the builder and paunch actions run,
debug/print-cmd that rely on it. This is achieved via a new parameter
for the real container name (a delegate) used for the "fixed" service
container name.

For podman builder, we use that delegate for conmon pidfile and logging
setup. So that now it always matches the PIDFile specified in the
systemd unit generated for that container.

For docker builder, we have no special uses for delegates, but we
support that parameter to simplify the code around (so that there will
be no need to wrap things with 'if cli == podman else...').

Closes-bug: #1839929

Change-Id: I5617e11f5d315f408d818e1ce47aa68f4a0d777a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatching fixed vs unique container names

Sometimes, like when redeploying in-place, containers for the "fixed"
service name might already existed, thus get the prefixed names. That
might create mismatches. For example the pidfile names may diverge by
the "fixzed" container service name vs its predictable prefixed unique
name.

Fix that by using the predictable unique names instead of the service
container names for the builder and paunch actions run,
debug/print-cmd that rely on it. This is achieved via a new parameter
for the real container name (a delegate) used for the "fixed" service
container name.

For podman builder, we use that delegate for conmon pidfile and logging
setup. So that now it always matches the PIDFile specified in the
systemd unit generated for that container.

For docker builder, we have no special uses for delegates, but we
support that parameter to simplify the code around (so that there will
be no need to wrap things with 'if cli == podman else...').

Closes-bug: #1839929

Change-Id: I5617e11f5d315f408d818e1ce47aa68f4a0d777a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a v2 API endpoint to push DataFrame objects

A new endpoint has been made available to admin users on
``POST /v2/dataframes``. This will allow end users to push
DataFrames in the form of JSON objects into the CloudKitty
storage.

Documentation and unit tests are included in this commit.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668669/
Change-Id: I42641462ecbac89f400a257805fc99f4027903b3
Story: 2005890
Task: 35953

commit_message:
Redis metadata using incorrect network/service

Metadata was set to use mysql network and service. This resulted
in Redis service principles never being generated for TLS-E deplo-
yments.

Change-Id: I55fecf3c7d02342b28570c1ad75edc927afa19ce
Partial-bug: #1838679

commit_message:
Revert "Create ansible environment variables in profile.d"

This reverts commit 1ac27c39eb3bf01c85daba1ddebe108cc47d1c4f.

Ansible environment enforcing broke logs collection (as any other task
with ansible on this host).
It should have "restored" after the job, not unset.
Change-Id: I34e1125ccdfa0560bd5688f99d788b20d67f646e

commit_message:
Run Update/Upgrade ansible playbook outside of mistral

Run the update and upgrade playbooks outside of mistral
and zaqar.
It will avoid some complexity and bad user experience
to debug and find issues when the ansible run is in
failure, because the first error shown is the mistral
workbook error

Depends-On: If18b707f3143703a04134f05ee0a287e1aa77916
Change-Id: I303c35c62026fa91b676e1ad5f89e89ae7711b47

commit_message:
Fix addon tag/version parsing

When doing rolling upgrade, the addon tag/version will be parsed
to make sure there is no downgrade. But if there is tag/version
is not well-formated, it can't be parsed by pbr.version.SemanticVersion.
This patch adds a catch to avoid throwing error and just skip
this case.

Task: 36186
Story: 2002210

Change-Id: I846cd0fd40a6607c36fff8992d98d8a55c49b3fa

commit_message:
Correct building DIB images in the CI

* Install bindep from diskimage-builder in the DIB image job
* Switch to using ironic-python-agent-builder script
* Include distribution and branch name into target file names
* Place resulting files into correct directories
* Switch the distribution to centos7 since ubuntu seems to require
  additional configuration
* Add dhcp-all-interfaces, otherwise the image won't DHCP

Change-Id: I3f95323fa59bde4d4be6ff356e5e9f20b7cd453c

hmm, answered comments last week, but forgot to "post" them. So here they are'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-06 18:43:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Since the goal process wants things in cycle-sized chunks I think we should frame this as a multi-part goal with part 1 for Train being the CLI parity and part 2 for U  being the Python library to SDK transitions.  Those two things are not dependent on each other and for any given project with no CLI work to do starting on part 2 would be totally acceptable.

Chris, does this still sound too broad?  I am concerned that if we narrow too much it is no longer a 'community goal'."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-06 20:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-03 22:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I really like the idea of this goal, but as my nova colleagues have said, I'm not sure how we can break this up in a way to have a piece that's achievable in one cycle, for nova. That said, how bad is it if a project can't achieve the entire goal and only make some progress? Is that an OK thing to do?

Would Dean's idea of "a multi-part goal with part 1 for Train being the CLI parity and part 2 for U  being the Python library to SDK transitions" work better for nova if it were swapped? Would porting to the SDK in Train be doable in one cycle for novaclient? Anyone [in nova] have any guess? (I don't know what porting to the SDK entails).'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-03 22:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> doable in one cycle for novaclient? Anyone [in nova] have any guess? (I don't know what porting to the SDK entails).

I don't think it's realistic to expect to land all of it in one cycle, whether "it" is porting to the SDK or bringing OSC to parity with novaclient. But that doesn't mean we need to trash this goal. It just means (I hope) that we can move forward with the expectation that it'll take us a few cycles.

I noted earlier [1] a way that the progression could work with minimal wasted effort. Setting a goal for how much we actually want to get done in Train seems like something that needs to happen at/after the PTG as we're setting priorities and determining which blueprints are "above the line".

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639376/4/goals/train/osc.rst@20'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-04-05 07:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

To tell the truth I am wondered how people misinterpret the goal. It is stated, that for Train it is __proposed__ to work mainly on switching from glanceclient in OSC to SDK implementation. It is not stated, that Compute should be migrated (only a preparation work by covering microver gaps should be done).

I see people are willing all of this to happen, but nobody really wants to do anything except of endless discussing. Further reducing of the scope does not make any sense for me personally, I would then just start implementing things and forget about making this a community goal. 
Sorry, being absolutely frustrated.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-05 14:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> To tell the truth I am wondered how people misinterpret the goal.
 > It is stated, that for Train it is __proposed__ to work mainly on
 > switching from glanceclient in OSC to SDK implementation. It is not
 > stated, that Compute should be migrated (only a preparation work by
 > covering microver gaps should be done).

Fair enough, but I don't see how a migration of only glanceclient makes sense for a community-wide goal. A community goal for only glance? That's what makes it confusing, at least for me.

 > I see people are willing all of this to happen, but nobody really
 > wants to do anything except of endless discussing. Further reducing
 > of the scope does not make any sense for me personally, I would
 > then just start implementing things and forget about making this a
 > community goal.
 > Sorry, being absolutely frustrated."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-04-10 14:48:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > To tell the truth I am wondered how people misinterpret the goal.
 > > It is stated, that for Train it is __proposed__ to work mainly on
 > > switching from glanceclient in OSC to SDK implementation. It is
 > not
 > > stated, that Compute should be migrated (only a preparation work
 > by
 > > covering microver gaps should be done).
 > 
 > Fair enough, but I don't see how a migration of only glanceclient
 > makes sense for a community-wide goal. A community goal for only
 > glance? That's what makes it confusing, at least for me.
 > 
Ditto I'm afraid. Is this not something that should be specific to glance? A goal for the project? A spec?"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-04-17 15:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

What comes to this spec in general I cannot support it from Glance point of view.

We gave the benefit of doubt years ago for OSC to be documented as the preferred client to interface with glance-api. At that time we made the call to keep glanceclient and it's CLI around to support our development efforts and to give OSC bit time to prove it's place. Well unfortunately what has been proven since is that lots of our help requests ends up to be "I'm trying to do <insert operation here> with `openstack x y z` and it doesn't work." and gets solved by "Try to use `glance y z` instead." This was recognized during the discussions in Berlin Summit, yet the only work that seems to happen since that is this proposal to make it community goal.

Just to make it clear at no point OSC team has approached the Glance project team to coordinate or help with these efforts or discuss their viability. Thus with our current resources I see more likely that we will keep the glanceclient around and move our documentation to reference it instead of openstackclient. Not only to make a statement of this experiment clearly not working out but to actually help our users to interact with the image service in a way we can sustain and support them.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-06-26 13:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Now that we have popup teams, this feels like something that can be done there?'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-06-26 19:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Now that we have popup teams, this feels like something that can be
 > done there?

Seems appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-06-27 12:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> > Now that we have popup teams, this feels like something that can
 > be
 > > done there?
 > 
 > Seems appropriate.

I seriously doubt pop up teams can achieve that, if the PTL is already -1 ing this idea. But it's indeed the "right" format according to the latest discussions.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-27 12:50:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Then I'm a popup team of one trying to close the compute API gaps and herd the cats there for OSC. Nothing really changes."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-06-27 12:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Then I'm a popup team of one trying to close the compute API gaps
 > and herd the cats there for OSC. Nothing really changes.

Matt, you know you're not counting for one.
But yeah."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-19 12:27:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

From where I'm standing, the following looks like it needs to happen:

1. This PR should be abandoned. It is not going to be accepted as a commmunity goal in this format and the debate within the comments is circular. Let's step out of here, and start having conversation elsewhere. 

2. To start those conversations, a pop-up team would be a suitable alternative to begin driving that work. Someone needs to step forward to lead the pop-up team. The TC recommends two individuals step forwards as indicated in the pop-up team Governance document here: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/popup-teams.html

3. The pop-up team must include Erno Kuvaja or a representative from the Glance team including Matt Reidemann. 

4. The leaders must then identify a clear objective, and a clear disband criteria.

If in case the pop-up team decide that this could be better drafted as a community goal for U, then that is a suitable alternative that can be defined using the new goal selection criteria that is being defined here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667932/ But this should not be decided before clear objectives are defined.

Thanks.

Provided nobody has any objections to the above, I will go ahead and abandon, and begin this conversation on openstack-discuss."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-19 12:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Rollcall-Vote-1 -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-08-19 12:29:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Rollcall-Vote-1

> From where I'm standing, the following looks like it needs to
 > happen:
 > 
 > 1. This PR should be abandoned. It is not going to be accepted as a
 > commmunity goal in this format and the debate within the comments
 > is circular. Let's step out of here, and start having conversation
 > elsewhere.
 > 
 > 2. To start those conversations, a pop-up team would be a suitable
 > alternative to begin driving that work. Someone needs to step
 > forward to lead the pop-up team. The TC recommends two individuals
 > step forwards as indicated in the pop-up team Governance document
 > here: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/popup-teams.html
 > 
 > 3. The pop-up team must include Erno Kuvaja or a representative
 > from the Glance team including Matt Reidemann.
 > 
 > 4. The leaders must then identify a clear objective, and a clear
 > disband criteria.
 > 
 > If in case the pop-up team decide that this could be better drafted
 > as a community goal for U, then that is a suitable alternative that
 > can be defined using the new goal selection criteria that is being
 > defined here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667932/ But this
 > should not be decided before clear objectives are defined.
 > 
 > Thanks.
 > 
 > Provided nobody has any objections to the above, I will go ahead
 > and abandon, and begin this conversation on openstack-discuss.

Well said!"}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-19 12:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Clarification point to item 3: "The pop-up team must include Erno Kuvaja or a representative from the Glance team including Matt Reidemann."

I should not have said "must". I should have said "should". It is my recommendation that Erno and Matt are included in these conversations, but not a hard and fast rule. I do not believe in giving 1 person veto power over a project.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-23 11:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No response to: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008601.html

Abandoning this patch and asking for conversation to remain in the mailing list. 
Thanks,
Alex'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 06:45:14.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35939

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ic5588d7351cf6f60775703bbb995c80c2647d335
"}]
commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35939

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

commit_message:
nova: Cleanup spec

- Rename files to openstack-nova-XXX instead of nova-XXX to be
  consistent with other projects
- Remove cert subpackage (which had no %files section but was still
  there)
- Fix Requires for openstack-nova-compute package. It was not
  installable on (open)SUSE systems
- Set PrivateTmp in .service files where possible. Useful so services
  don't share a /tmp directory which is good from a security POV

Change-Id: Icbab616a65b40252a7c00cfed8e0cfad0d20ac60

commit_message:
Remove API site information

The api-guide is now in openstack-manuals and api-site does not get
translated anymore, remove section.

Also, update link for project-info.

Make this dependent on 678463 to test that publishing of PDFs works.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678463
Change-Id: I1ca036fb853dfc86284b173a41829e973b582800

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 16:33:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mismatching fixed vs unique container names

Sometimes, like when redeploying in-place, containers for the "fixed"
service name might already existed, thus get the prefixed names. That
might create mismatches. For example the pidfile names may diverge by
the "fixzed" container service name vs its predictable prefixed unique
name.

Fix that by using the predictable unique names instead of the service
container names for the builder and paunch actions run,
debug/print-cmd that rely on it. This is achieved via a new parameter
for the real container name (a delegate) used for the "fixed" service
container name.

For podman builder, we use that delegate for conmon pidfile and logging
setup. So that now it always matches the PIDFile specified in the
systemd unit generated for that container.

For docker builder, we have no special uses for delegates, but we
support that parameter to simplify the code around (so that there will
be no need to wrap things with 'if cli == podman else...').

Conflicts:
    paunch/builder/podman.py

Closes-bug: #1839929

Change-Id: I5617e11f5d315f408d818e1ce47aa68f4a0d777a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5d174c1bea474a34da6f4f68173323a8243c4fc5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatching fixed vs unique container names

Sometimes, like when redeploying in-place, containers for the "fixed"
service name might already existed, thus get the prefixed names. That
might create mismatches. For example the pidfile names may diverge by
the "fixzed" container service name vs its predictable prefixed unique
name.

Fix that by using the predictable unique names instead of the service
container names for the builder and paunch actions run,
debug/print-cmd that rely on it. This is achieved via a new parameter
for the real container name (a delegate) used for the "fixed" service
container name.

For podman builder, we use that delegate for conmon pidfile and logging
setup. So that now it always matches the PIDFile specified in the
systemd unit generated for that container.

For docker builder, we have no special uses for delegates, but we
support that parameter to simplify the code around (so that there will
be no need to wrap things with 'if cli == podman else...').

Conflicts:
    paunch/builder/podman.py

Closes-bug: #1839929

Change-Id: I5617e11f5d315f408d818e1ce47aa68f4a0d777a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5d174c1bea474a34da6f4f68173323a8243c4fc5)

subject: Fix VHD detach
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-05 13:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-07 16:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-07 16:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-07 16:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-21 17:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-21 17:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2019-08-21 20:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-26 09:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-26 09:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit c51aaa1a53ce2dec9b641e4d6059a94262c869b0'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-05 13:39:11.000000000', 'message': "WIP: workaround for VHD detach

Attempting to disconnect a VHD from the local host may fail if the
image is in-use by a different host.

The reason is that the detach API requires a handle, which we may
fail to obtain if the file is in-use (even by a different host).

This change will try to figure out if the image is actually attached
to the local host before erroring out. It's currently marked as WIP
because of two reasons:
* it doesn't resolve symlinks, which Cinder uses. Unfortunately we
  os.path.realpath doesn't work on Windows. We may use
  GetFinalPathNameByHandleA, and the Msft_Disk.Location field
  seems to include resolved paths (at least on WS 2019, not sure
  about other versions/builds).
* missing tests

Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 15:21:14.000000000', 'message': "WIP: workaround for VHD detach

Attempting to disconnect a VHD from the local host may fail if the
image is in-use by a different host.

The reason is that the detach API requires a handle, which we may
fail to obtain if the file is in-use (even by a different host).

This change will try to figure out if the image is actually attached
to the local host before erroring out. This check is a bit more
complicated than it should, again due to file locks. We'll use
two approaches:
* the preffered way, using virtdisk.dll:GetVirtualDiskInformation,
  which may fail due to file locks
* the slower way, used as a fallback, which involves getting a full
  list of attached images and comparing file and volume ids as
  the file may be accessible through multiple paths

It's currently marked as WIP because it's missing unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 15:26:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP: workaround for VHD detach

Attempting to disconnect a VHD from the local host may fail if the
image is in-use by a different host, even though it's not actually
mounted on the local host.

The reason is that the detach API requires a handle, which we may
fail to obtain if the file is in-use.

This change will try to figure out if the image is actually attached
to the local host before erroring out. This check is a bit more
complicated than it should, again due to file locks. We'll use
two approaches:
* the preffered way, using virtdisk.dll:GetVirtualDiskInformation,
  which may fail due to file locks
* the slower way, used as a fallback, which involves getting a full
  list of attached images and comparing file and volume ids as
  the file may be accessible through multiple paths

It's currently marked as WIP because it's missing unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 16:00:23.000000000', 'message': "WIP: workaround for VHD detach

Attempting to disconnect a VHD from the local host may fail if the
image is in-use by a different host, even though it's not actually
mounted on the local host.

The reason is that the detach API requires a handle, which we may
fail to obtain if the file is in-use.

This change will try to figure out if the image is actually attached
to the local host before erroring out. This check is a bit more
complicated than it should, again due to file locks. We'll use
two approaches:
* the preffered way, using virtdisk.dll:GetVirtualDiskInformation,
  which may fail due to file locks
* the slower way, used as a fallback, which involves getting a full
  list of attached images and comparing file and volume ids as
  the file may be accessible through multiple paths

It's currently marked as WIP because it's missing unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 16:23:10.000000000', 'message': "WIP: workaround for VHD detach

Attempting to disconnect a VHD from the local host may fail if the

It's currently marked as WIP because it's missing unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf

mounted on the local host.

The reason is that the detach API requires a handle, which we may
fail to obtain if the file is in-use.

This change will try to figure out if the image is actually attached
to the local host before erroring out. This check is a bit more
complicated than it should, again due to file locks. We'll use
two approaches:
* the preffered way, using virtdisk.dll:GetVirtualDiskInformation,
  which may fail due to file locks
* the slower way, used as a fallback, which involves getting a full
  list of attached images and comparing file and volume ids as
  the file may be accessible through multiple paths

Closes-Bug: #1840954
Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf

commit_message:
Fix VHD detach

Attempting to disconnect a VHD from the local host may fail if the
image is in-use by a different host, even though it's not actually
mounted on the local host.

The reason is that the detach API requires a handle, which we may
fail to obtain if the file is in-use.

This change will try to figure out if the image is actually attached
to the local host before erroring out. This check is a bit more
complicated than it should, again due to file locks. We'll use
two approaches:
* the preffered way, using virtdisk.dll:GetVirtualDiskInformation,
  which may fail due to file locks
* the slower way, used as a fallback, which involves getting a full
  list of attached images and comparing file and volume ids as
  the file may be accessible through multiple paths

Closes-Bug: #1840954
Change-Id: Ib5bf0070c0ba4cb18e98c1cb983c641eaae582bf

commit_message:
Adds dhcp-all-interfaces element

Changes the value of IRONIC_DIB_RAMDISK_OPTIONS to
'centos7 dhcp-all-interfaces' from 'ubuntu' to resolve
the issue in passing the ironic-python-agent-buildimage-dib
test.
Based on the comments of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676239/

Change-Id: I92f44370cbd10c192c26cceb1589990f74985e92
Task: 36375
Story: 2005114

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 13:46:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix GET /v1/dataframes endpoint

When switching to DataFrames objects, a mistake has been made in the
DataFrameController object: the "resources" list was not emptied once a
dataframe was created, leading to a datapoint duplication in the command
output.

The bug hasn't been detected at that time, because each usage type in a
dataframe only contained a single data point. Gabbi fixtures have been
updated to include several points per dataframe and avoid a future
regression.

Change-Id: Ib41f0c91232ed06b82b6bb9f60ab316fc76e5209
'}]
commit_message:
Fix GET /v1/dataframes endpoint

When switching to DataFrames objects, a mistake has been made in the
DataFrameController object: the "resources" list was not emptied once a
dataframe was created, leading to a datapoint duplication in the command
output.

The bug hasn't been detected at that time, because each usage type in a
dataframe only contained a single data point. Gabbi fixtures have been
updated to include several points per dataframe and avoid a future
regression.

Change-Id: Ib41f0c91232ed06b82b6bb9f60ab316fc76e5209

* HPMSA-iSCSI http://os-logs.tristero.net/hpmsa-ci/47/671947/1/HPMSA-iSCSI : SUCCESS in 42:00.47'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-07-24 12:52:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not against this, but the problem that excluding .zuul.yaml is meant to solve is being able to adjust the irrelevant files without having to wait many hours (because you only notice that this is a problem when the gate is clogged up) for it to take place.

We can avoid the gate breakage here as long as any change to .zuul.yaml that actually changes a job also removes .zuul.yaml from the irrelevant files on the first patch, so that we know the jobs run correctly.  But this strategy relies on developer/reviewer discipline, not automation, so maybe Luigi is right."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-07-24 13:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I understand the issue, but I'm not sure whether there is a real solution. I will probably ask Zuul developers to confirm that there are no other options."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-07-29 11:06:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not against this, but the problem that excluding .zuul.yaml is
 > meant to solve is being able to adjust the irrelevant files without
 > having to wait many hours (because you only notice that this is a
 > problem when the gate is clogged up) for it to take place.
 > 
 > We can avoid the gate breakage here as long as any change to
 > .zuul.yaml that actually changes a job also removes .zuul.yaml from
 > the irrelevant files on the first patch, so that we know the jobs
 > run correctly.  But this strategy relies on developer/reviewer
 > discipline, not automation, so maybe Luigi is right.

I will say changes in irrelevant-files is not frequent. That is one time things which project define for each integrated jobs. 

Rest other changes in .zuul.yaml has to test the complete set of integrated tests. 

Making it run the specific jobs which get changes in that patch first also does not save much as it can be base job change and it will run jobs once so not so much saving."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-07-29 11:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm. irrelevant-files changes are not so frequent so it is ok to keep this file out of it.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-07-31 15:21:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I think it's better to err on the side of caution with this optimization, so this makes sense to me.  History says that if we leave a way to shoot ourselves in the foot, we will surely do just that.

I've also had similar concerns about setup.cfg being listed as irrelevant in the zuul config, but haven't explored that in depth... I suspect it's similarly risky."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-08-21 09:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I really like this change!'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-21 09:53:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > 
 > I've also had similar concerns about setup.cfg being listed as
 > irrelevant in the zuul config, but haven't explored that in
 > depth... I suspect it's similarly risky.

I think setup.cfg should be covered by unit and functional tests. those tests run for setup.cfg changes. Integration tests of that repo might not be required for setup.cfg untill i am not missing any corner cases."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-21 21:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-08-22 07:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2019-07-21 21:55:11.000000000', 'message': "Never skip jobs when .zuul.yaml is changed

This is a partial revert of https://review.opendev.org/650138/

Currently it is possible to send a review which only touches
.zuul.yaml and changes the functional/tempest/grenade jobs
in a way that breaks them (for example, by removing 'voting: false',
or adding a new job of the said type, or altering their definition
with new parameters). Such changes would not be gated, thus
allowing it to be merged.

Change-Id: Id2b1476fbe0ae7bffd8f64e6f870bdc3721abbb8
"}]
commit_message:
Never skip jobs when .zuul.yaml is changed

This is a partial revert of https://review.opendev.org/650138/

Currently it is possible to send a review which only touches
.zuul.yaml and changes the functional/tempest/grenade jobs
in a way that breaks them (for example, by removing 'voting: false',
or adding a new job of the said type, or altering their definition
with new parameters). Such changes would not be gated, thus
allowing it to be merged.

Change-Id: Id2b1476fbe0ae7bffd8f64e6f870bdc3721abbb8

commit_message:
Check node trait before creating server

Placement may fail to update trait because of Conflict
the trait may be updated by the Nova compute
update_available_resource periodic task.
We need node status is enabled, so we check the node
trait and delay if it is not the correct status.
the max delay time is 10 minutes.

Depends-on: Ie98e2c000568ecac63e8981a8b7087029c0d3705

Change-Id: I3e45d4a66a6e1bf55499def8550da38ddf01b638

commit_message:
Create ansible environment variables in profile.d

This change sets our desired ansible options as default environment variables
on systems where the `tripleo-bootstrap` role is executed. This change will
ensure all of our ansible resources are accessible by users of the system,
using the default shell, and are executed in an expected way, mirroring what
we setup within our mistral ansible configuration file.

Change-Id: If5a997dc2698dc286e118289431cc441e3c03199
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Generate an unique prefix for each config worker

Make sure each MP worker executed by the container-puppet tool
holds a unique name. This removes race conditions, when multiple
workers configure the same config volume of a service.

Change-Id: I8bc8df70fad41afc5ccc7a6b4834595d55857db6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Beyond that, tests look nonexistant (tox is commented out)

Code quality wise it looks simple, so likely fine.

I'm setting the -2 because of the licencing issue, other issues are easier to fix/verify"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-07-03 09:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-07-03 09:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

no worries, thanks for the feedback.

NB sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter is licensed under BSD and I can see a lot of the same license type around in the global-requirements.txt'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-07-03 14:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

ok, that's a bit better, the all rights reserved threw me (old format of the two clause licence it looks like)

I still have concerns about their testing, but that's it"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-07-05 18:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Matthew, just to be clear, is your -1 to block until you see tests are being run for the project first?'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-07-05 18:19:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

yep, it's not a hard block on it"}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-23 13:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This has been merged already: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677433/'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-23 13:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-08-26 07:14:23.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks Alexandra, that's nice to know!"}]

Use promote for publishing

avoids an extra run after release.

commit_message:
Rebase api-guide/ref jobs

We based these jobs on opendev-tox-docs since openstack-tox-docs was
migrated later to promote jobs. Switch them back to openstack-tox-docs
so that requirements are set up correctly.

Disable PDF building for these for now.

Change-Id: I1d17858e15c4934cd9625ec31cde7a095aac26a0

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Ib3bf99b1fcb81d70aae3125734b3fe21e6b1aa5b

commit_message:
Remove now obsolete publish jobs

The deploy-guide and contributor-guide jobs are now unused since
switching to promote jobs. Remove them and the playbook that is not
shared.

Use unique names in promote.yaml (copying over
https://review.opendev.org/677662)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677803
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677802
Change-Id: I0c18f0b5aeeabdf40a86627a8f003969dd428151

commit_message:
Revert "tinyipa: update qemu and tgt dependencies"

This change might have broken the CI with
qemu-img: error while loading shared libraries: libxml2.so.2

This reverts commit 70c49424a4ed859794b40ddd264f1d479fabb91d.

Change-Id: Iec20d7443268f0f2d6de4e6cecad26ab3f81db49

commit_message:
Drop creating extra endpoints in devstack

We don't need admin or internal endpoints in a normal devstack setup,
other basic projects are also only creating the public endpoint now.

Change-Id: Iaafec07cf9a0196b5da850924b98e3aa94d559f1

commit_message:
worker: Re-add FailoverPreparationForAmphora

This tasks removes the dns_name option from ports, so that they can be
plugged into a new amphora, which has a different name. This was lost in
change I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec.

Story: 2006205
Task: 35791

Conflicts:
    octavia/controller/worker/v1/flows/amphora_flows.py

Change-Id: I4230feae5b6f0778b738bddbc69c5a0cd3e6930c
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit c4c7387f8904075b961612b5a08aff47c51c081c)

commit_message:
worker: Re-add FailoverPreparationForAmphora

This tasks removes the dns_name option from ports, so that they can be
plugged into a new amphora, which has a different name. This was lost in
change I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec.

Story: 2006205
Task: 35791

Conflicts:
    octavia/controller/worker/v1/flows/amphora_flows.py

Change-Id: I4230feae5b6f0778b738bddbc69c5a0cd3e6930c
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit c4c7387f8904075b961612b5a08aff47c51c081c)

commit_message:
Parse the new PCI request from flavor extra specs when resize

When resize instance, the new flavor may includes new PCI requests.
This patch will parse those PCI requests from flavor and merge
those request with existed SRIOV pci requests.

Change-Id: Id8bc7c57e28b63fa1e6b3d3a6407d6db6d123c4e
Closes-Bug: #1805767

commit_message:
Support instance creation and resize with pmems

* Parse the `hw:pmem` in flavor extra_spec to get pmems request
  and translate to resource request.

* Introduce claim/unclaim/purge_pmems into DeviceManager, so they
  will be called when claim/unclaim/purge_for_instance.

* Build xml with pmems if there are claimed pmems, all pmems will
  be put under guest numa node 0.

Change-Id: Ia56a361c06b0671d9fc2eda42be3cbbe517aaa52
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-02 10:45:32.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: report pmem namespaces resources by provider tree

Report pmem namespaces resources to the provider tree after pmem
namespaces configration. Custom Resource Classes are used to
represent PMEM namespace resource here. Currently, the placement
doesn't support NUMA affinity, so the PMEM resource inventories
are belong to ComputeNode ResourceProvider directly.

Partiallly-Implements: blueprint supporting virtual persistent memory

Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Change-Id: I729dce1c12a48c2f3599b4a16d6b2b90354db767

commit_message:
Report pmem namespaces resources by provider tree

Get pmem namespaces info from device manager, and report
pmem namespaces resources to the provider tree. Custom
Resource Classes are used to represent PMEM namespace
resource here.

Change-Id: I729dce1c12a48c2f3599b4a16d6b2b90354db767
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Populates existing pmems in libvirt device manager

DeviceManager is used to track all pmem namespaces and if
they are assigned or not. So when init_host, existing pmems
should be found and populated to device manager.

* Add one configuration option CONF.libvirt.pmem_namespaces:
  "$LABEL:$NSNAME[|$NSNAME][,$LABEL:$NSNAME[|$NSNAME]]"
  e.g. "128G:ns0|ns1|ns2|ns3,262144MB:ns4|ns5,MEDIUM:ns6|ns7"

* Introduce new PMEMDevice obj to contain pmem namespaces info.
  And use instance uuid and flavor id to mark that who it is
  assigned to.

* To ensure all pmems not assigned are clean, we check if there
  are any incomplete migrations to current host, and if yes,
  cleanup all unassigned pmem namespaces.

Change-Id: Ie926c58153a3dacf48314ca693fb847d81fd81a0
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Indroduce new LibvirtConfigGuestPMEM

Indroduce new LibvirtConfigGuestPMEM, which will be used
to format domain to xml or parse domain from xml for
persistent memory devices.

Change-Id: I6dfa9ac3e51e5e8456d7020b3ade7b78fa892dac
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Remove disable_constraints

The change this depends on removes the nova and glance custom
constraint usage, so disable_constraints is no longer required.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675204/
Change-Id: I691a8bbe17b4deb72ad3b996c0fdb43040a151a3

commit_message:
Cluster coe-version should be fixed in command line

The 'coe-version' could be an optional parameter of command 'magnum cluster-create'.

Change-Id: I5e1ea20dce3bfe3403bba0c207497c99c68aaa0d
Implements: blueprint coe-version

You pushed a patch yesterday for typos [1]. IMO It's really bad to have a lot of this commits in our tree, especially since they are doubled because we merge with an additional commit.

I propose to hold this patch for some days in case more typos are found. Cores please don't merge fast.

@yuhui If you intent to search for more typos please do, but don't many small "fix some typos" patches.

[{'created': '2016-12-12 08:49:26.000000000', 'message': 'Validate router when user specify a existing router

Check the existence of router.
Check the router name to see if there is duplicate name. If so,
advise user to use network ID.

Partially Implements: blueprint specify-existing-router

Change-Id: I1545a91bcdb983a9f1ee1e1e09b5762d16d3d21b
'}]
commit_message:
Validate router when user specify a existing router

Check the existence of router.
Check the router name to see if there is duplicate name. If so,
advise user to use network ID.

Partially Implements: blueprint specify-existing-router

Change-Id: I1545a91bcdb983a9f1ee1e1e09b5762d16d3d21b

[{'created': '2017-08-05 08:39:27.000000000', 'message': 'Specify apiserver-count parameter for kube-apiserver

kubernetes apiserver should include --apiserver-count, if not specify,
1 is default. And the kubernetes service will only include a single
endpoint.
Same issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/24327

Change-Id: If3dd3bf5806c7c1f5a02ec0bc6c353578ccecd65
'}, {'created': '2017-08-05 08:40:16.000000000', 'message': 'Specify apiserver-count parameter for kube-apiserver

kubernetes apiserver should include --apiserver-count, if not specify,
1 is default. And the kubernetes service will only include a single
endpoint.
Same issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/22609

Change-Id: If3dd3bf5806c7c1f5a02ec0bc6c353578ccecd65
'}]
commit_message:
Specify apiserver-count parameter for kube-apiserver

kubernetes apiserver should include --apiserver-count, if not specify,
1 is default. And the kubernetes service will only include a single
endpoint.
Same issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/22609

Change-Id: If3dd3bf5806c7c1f5a02ec0bc6c353578ccecd65

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-05 08:04:01.000000000', 'message': 'Use lb vip for etcd-servers

Currently kube-apiserver use 127.0.0.1:2379 for etcd-servers.
If etcd cluster have multiple etcd nodes, we should specify etcd
lb vip for etcd-servers to enable HA.

Change-Id: Ib4b2fa057e1cd46e56a41e2e697c3e2149f40b94
'}]
commit_message:
Use lb vip for etcd-servers

Currently kube-apiserver use 127.0.0.1:2379 for etcd-servers.
If etcd cluster have multiple etcd nodes, we should specify etcd
lb vip for etcd-servers to enable HA.

Change-Id: Ib4b2fa057e1cd46e56a41e2e697c3e2149f40b94

commit_message:
Improve devmode=flase when building the image

During debugging, the following changes are also included:

- Support to specify an image ID to run the integration test.
- Fix the reboot function bug.
- Remove the unsuccessful restart test.

How to run integration test with dev_mode=false:

    ADMIN_PASSWORD=password \
    SERVICE_PASSWORD=password \
    DEV_MODE=false \
    /opt/stack/trove/integration/scripts/trovestack gate-tests mysql mysql

Change-Id: I31d4ee579a554f4c98f9facb9fd4b7779665a3dd
