commit_message:
Adjust for bp:remove-pool-group-totally

the zaqar service started  refusing to handle the group
parameter with the error message:

"Additional properties are not allowed (u'group' was unexpected)"

Also pool_group was removed. the server change is
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/628723/15

which is related to http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/zaqar-specs/specs/stein/remove-pool-group-totally.html

Change-Id: I7aac8b53115ff2380e3597b5a940d3899b416c6e
Closes-Bug: #1839614

commit_message:
Add a flag to create the reproducer script

Your local setup should be able to give you a copy of the
reproducer-quickstart.sh script.  This is useful when you don't want to go
hunting for a ci job which might have one, e.g. when creating new OVB
environments.

Change-Id: Ia72fa237cc91f9b23e8554b90c62b62976e3f1cf

From what I can tell this is failing because an exception was not raised in Tempest... perhaps it's an actual barbican/glance bug?"}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-08 00:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-08 00:58:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Its failing because a parameter needs to be set in nova config to tell nova to check the signature.  I have added a review to fix this.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-08 15:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-08 16:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

@Ade: The image signing test is now passing, but the encrypted cinder volume tests are failing with the error "Required image properties for signature verification do not exist" ( see http://logs.openstack.org/64/524064/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-container/24d3375/logs/tempest.html.gz ).

When the verify_glance_signatures flag is set, all images that are booted must have associated signature metadata, or they will fail to boot.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-08 21:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-09 07:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-12 05:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-13 07:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@bpoulos and @kfarr -- this really feels like a usability issue.

Deployers cannot migrate to using signature verification without having signed all of their images ahead of time.  And they cannot use a whole slew of tempest tests to verify their deployment because most of these tests are not glance signature verification aware.

What about a verification_optional flag which would allow nova to boot images that either have a valid signature, or that have no signature.  Deployers can then set this parameter until all their images have been signed, and the tests they want to execute have been updated.

Concurrently, we need to update the tests in openstack-tempest to be glance signature verification aware - if say a conf flag is set.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I added this:  https://review.openstack.org/528017 in case we agree to add the optional verification flag.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-15 14:53:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Just a note.  I'm working on a patch to python-tempestconf to make it aware of nova image verification when setting up the config for tempest tests."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-15 20:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-15 20:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Compensate for network problems in build-test-packages

This change adds a retry mechanism for temporary network failure, and a fallback mechanism with which we can specify an alternate host to try to get stuff from in case the first url is completely down

Closes-Bug: #1791941

Change-Id: Iffdf4e47e3bd23ad092faade799e2d23ba7bd085

commit_message:
Fail build-test-package if project not found

When build-test-package cannot find one of the projects from the reviews
and is not an skipped project it has to fail so we don't have partial repos.

Test reviews:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/18892
Test build-test-packages RPM and non-RPM

https://review.rdoproject.org/r/18891
Test build-test-packages one review good one bad

Closes-Bug: #1815744

Change-Id: Ia79039cbe139053ab7133749a70f28c1d80d40e7

commit_message:
Remove overcloud image download during prep images

This commit removes the overcloud image download ability to the prep
images role, since there's no need to do it here while we already have a
role dedicated to that (fetch-images, in tripleo-quickstart) and it
might confuse users.

Change-Id: Iaf0ade7c103b800b70f1db964d7ed41501ef9657

commit_message:
WIP: Update default for THT resource registry

The default resource registry in THT should be the templated one
(overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml) rather than
environments/docker.yaml.

Setting this as WIP, because it might only be a valid default
starting on some release and needs testing.

Change-Id: Ic98f4f6cf6337d477a56494d9fa6e7644ae524f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-17 03:13:05.000000000', 'message': 'add delorean-current to repolist for updates

The list of containers that are updated are generated
from a list of rpms from the gating repo.  These
containers are updated w/ the gating repo and dlrn-current.

That makes the above set of containers out of sync w/
the rest of the containers.  The list of containers
that are updated needs to include changes required
by dlrn-current AND the gating repo.

fix if statement w/ mixed_upgrade

Related-Bug #1786764

Change-Id: Iea3e787679c54194e0028028ac1b202ddb929155
'}]
commit_message:
add delorean-current to repolist for updates

The list of containers that are updated are generated
from a list of rpms from the gating repo.  These
containers are updated w/ the gating repo and dlrn-current.

That makes the above set of containers out of sync w/
the rest of the containers.  The list of containers
that are updated needs to include changes required
by dlrn-current AND the gating repo.

fix if statement w/ mixed_upgrade

Related-Bug #1786764

Change-Id: Iea3e787679c54194e0028028ac1b202ddb929155

commit_message:
ovb-manage: Allow the use of localhost as undercloud part of the stack

In upstream OVB tests, the undercloud is usually created by nodepool, then the
current tooling creates an OVB environment using the existing undercloud
This change adds this kind of behaviour to the role

Change-Id: Ia0205624219d024d9226af6681932e79f0df6374

commit_message:
ovb-manage: stop carrying password around

This change generates a token at the start of the role from username and
password, then offers a credentials file, with ONLY the token to be used by the
cli calls in the tasks.

Change-Id: Ifd6b28ffeba4c7a3bad7bc388371b97a55fae2c6

commit_message:
export OVERCLOUD_HOSTS when running enable-ssh-admin.sh

enable-ssh-admin.sh requires OVERCLOUD_HOSTS to be available per
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/
deployed-server/scripts/enable-ssh-admin.sh#n40
This change exports the var before running enable-ssh-admin.sh
so the tripleo-admin user gets created on the overcloud and is
available for subsequent operations such as upgrade.

Related-Bug: 1772121

Change-Id: I369996b5568a88d5eda4bb151852ac719ba99a7d

commit_message:
Collect logs: add ansible steps log file to logstash index

Ansible steps log is missing from the file we want to index in
logstash.
This change adds it.

Change-Id: Icfccd5bd37fd27384e7fdff2748ce46f3e98cfdb

Maybe this won’t help with https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1792872 but could with https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1794952 where we are seeing:

commit_message:
turn ironic automated_clean off

The ovb jobs running in rdo-cloud are often failing
in overcloud_prep_images.  The details are in the bug,
however the cleaning of nodes is not required and
causing additional risk of the job failing.

https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3349081

Closes-Bug: #1792872
Change-Id: Ib6ae898ade97dd41b627cdab4b1edbd8b47b0e93

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-04 08:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-10-12 07:43:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

-1 because wip and missing context in the commit message :) but mostly just to say i've looked here /firstpass

so what is the plan for the ugprade team if they aren't using these anymore do you have more info ? a while back i posted somethign related (for the https://trello.com/c/6xqcXtM7/859-translate-oooqcommonfunctionsshj2-piece-by-piece-to-ansible-tasks which has since been moved to taiga but not sprint 20 and i'm rover now anyway :) ) but there i moved the 'release' into the job definition https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605410/1/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml and was using in quickstart. sh https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605410/1/playbooks/tripleo-ci/templates/toci_quickstart.sh.j2"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-15 07:17:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > -1 because wip and missing context in the commit message :) but
 > mostly just to say i've looked here /firstpass
 > 
 > so what is the plan for the ugprade team if they aren't using these
 > anymore do you have more info ? a while back i posted somethign
 > related (for the https://trello.com/c/6xqcXtM7/859-translate-oooqcommonfunctionsshj2-piece-by-piece-to-ansible-tasks
 > which has since been moved to taiga but not sprint 20 and i'm rover
 > now anyway :) ) but there i moved the 'release' into the job
 > definition https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605410/1/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml
 > and was using in quickstart. sh https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605410/1/playbooks/tripleo-ci/templates/toci_quickstart.sh.j2

Well, the idea is getting rid of the upgrade releases file and depend on the normal ones (queens.yaml/rocky.yaml), passing them on each playbook. Some of the needed variables for upgrades which are now contained in those <release>-undercloud-<release-1>-overcloud.yaml files would be moved to the featuresets https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607175/ (or the vars section in the zuul v3 job definition at a higher level). Remove the reference to target_upgrade_version (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607525/2) and use release instead, as we're passing to each playbook the right release. And as an extra step, isolate the subnodes repo setting up into a playbook aside, to which the right release is being passed too: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604120/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604121/ . So far it looks quite promising...we managed to have the ocata to pike job running again (and found a legitimate issue: https://logs.rdoproject.org/21/604121/10/openstack-experimental/legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode-upgrades-pike-branch/fc555d2/ LP bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1796664
But we need some tuning in still for containers image preparation, to work with the old and new releases."}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-22 07:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-11-10 10:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-11-23 10:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-12-12 13:18:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-01-02 11:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-08-25 11:00:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

because long time passed since last update'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 06:59:25.000000000', 'message': 'Run emit_releases_file.py for all featuresets

This is needed in case we want  to do stuff like
cleanup QUICKSTART_RELEASE, and UPGRADE_RELEASE
variables, and also cleanup the upgrade bash code
from toci, to do bigger refactorings.

This is part of the card at [1]

[1] https://trello.com/c/DdSHkgnE/884-replace-tocijobtype-variable-s17-undercloud-playbooks-environment-tags

To test this we have to exercise the same stuff we do

commit_message:
Run emit_releases_file.py for all featuresets

This is needed in case we want  to do stuff like
cleanup QUICKSTART_RELEASE, and UPGRADE_RELEASE
variables, and also cleanup the upgrade bash code
from toci, to do bigger refactorings.

This is part of the card at [1]

[1] https://trello.com/c/DdSHkgnE/884-replace-tocijobtype-variable-s17-undercloud-playbooks-environment-tags

To test this we have to do the same stuff we do
at the noop changes:

master: 	https://review.openstack.org/589383
stable/queens: 	https://review.openstack.org/589380
stable/pike: 	https://review.openstack.org/589381

Change-Id: Ic076ea5f6c697fc89dd97885d3a12bdf9978d35b

commit_message:
Add a full upgrades job for featureset056

Adding this new upgrades job -full to run a full
upgrade path (rocky to master) as the opposite of
the normal job ( -upgrades) which will run a master
to master upgrade

Change-Id: If80d9bdc53f097b77f35080566fe9c3368f93b1b
Depends-On: I6e64f39e44eaf22b9402862e93613eb107bf26c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 14:03:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add new featureset for a rocky to master jobs

While we are moving the featureset051 to a simple
master to master job, to get it voting, this review
creates a new featureset that aim to run the normal
upgrade: release -1 to release.
This kind of job might be unstable and hit timeout, so
it will probably stay to non-voting, rather than the 051
aim to be voting.

Change-Id: I6e64f39e44eaf22b9402862e93613eb107bf26c8
'}]
commit_message:
Add new featureset for a rocky to master jobs

While we are moving the featureset051 to a simple
master to master job, to get it voting, this review
creates a new featureset that aim to run the normal
upgrade: release -1 to release.
This kind of job might be unstable and hit timeout, so
it will probably stay to non-voting, rather than the 051
aim to be voting.

Change-Id: I6e64f39e44eaf22b9402862e93613eb107bf26c8

commit_message:
WIP: Link subnodes-setup into multinode jobs.

A new playbook subnode-setup has been added in
which the overcloud instance repositories and
packages are configured taking the release file
defined in OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_RELEASE var from
releases.sh.
This way, we ensure the right repositories are
configured independently if it's an mixed versions
job or not.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607846
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607833
Related-Bug: #1791115
Change-Id: Ic7ba189256d28818d4048f5b942737756542ec95

There is a lot of good content in here, however I would rather pull some of the ideas out of the patch.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-07-05 19:26:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

Things I like about this patch..
1. consolidating the variables
2. dry run w/ the variables to create a script w/ all the ansible-playbook invocations.

However most of the variables used in this script are probably not required now as we can pass variables to the jobs [1]. Let's focus on what we can pass directly to zuul first and then bring these concepts back online.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml#L107"}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

This patch has some good ideas ( creating a vars file to be sourced by later playbooks) - some we may need to implement for intermediate solutions but I would like to investigate how much we can get by with passing vars directly to jobs.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:40:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

To continue my comments ... so I would prefer not to merge it as is for the moment. But it's good to see something working with the new format"}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-07-06 12:58:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

This patch has good ideas on variables consolidation and gathering playbooks in a single place. However, I'd just use the approach applied here to refactor the tripleo-ci scripts with the rest of the team in smaller chunks of work."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-08-19 21:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-08-25 10:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

because long time passed since last update'}]

commit_message:
DNM: Run only CI playbooks in run.yml zuul playbook

Generate list of commands to run in job, while other preparement
work is moved to pre.yml. Run only CI playbooks using file
playbook_executions.sh where all variables are loaded and all
playbooks are running.
This file could be useful for custom local deployments, where
running playbooks one by one with customizations.
Saves 5 minutes for every job.

Change-Id: Ieebf477e4cb03d8b8c3c2460cd4a73b083a3c480

commit_message:
tox: make pytest verbose

Add -v flag to pytest tests. Without it, pytest shows only the files
being processed. When we add new unit test, we can now see explicitly
that the test ran and passed.

Change-Id: Ib9407b4401897797f7da892efe1bf200e869c7d8

commit_message:
Fix periodic undercloud install release file

If we want to add featureset050 (undercloud upgrade) to the periodic
jobs the undercloud_install_release have to be the release file
without the periodic suffix "promotion-testing-hash-"

Change-Id: I0a68d030a049fdba98a29b5ead9be17502557eb0

commit_message:
Fix stackviz data

In third party logs server, the stackviz data gzipped isn't being
gunzipped in real time, so, it doesn't render stackviz report properly,
saying there's no records.

Change-Id: I26d8d80f834c833811a2f2b76a8d8fe3e2f20e44

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-17 04:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-17 07:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-07-24 18:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

where is the job running that shows these changes work?

do we need a tripleo-common patch with a depends-on?'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-24 19:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> where is the job running that shows these changes work?

This was tested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583068/

However, we had to work around this failure and ended up merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583413/ with changes squashed together anyway.

That said, I still think this is technically more correct way of installing

> do we need a tripleo-common patch with a depends-on?

I don't think so"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 23:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Specifically you can see that the change took effect in

 http://logs.openstack.org/68/583068/8/check/tripleo-buildimage-overcloud-full-centos-7/dfa86c9/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-17_05_07_24_383162
 http://logs.openstack.org/68/583068/8/check/tripleo-buildimage-overcloud-full-centos-7/dfa86c9/logs/upper-constraints.txt.gz

Note diskimage-builder and tripleo-common are missing from the latter.

Contrast that with the failed build from:

 http://logs.openstack.org/68/583068/7/check/tripleo-buildimage-overcloud-full-centos-7/69d1cbb/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-17_03_05_41_807218

where we got network-2.1 even though at the time[1] upper-constraints.txt contained networkx===1.11


[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/upper-constraints.txt?id=90c002e#n82'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-08-25 10:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

because long time passed since last update'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 04:17:12.000000000', 'message': "Use constraints when when building images

Currently the way we install diskimage-builder doesn't use constraints,
but DIB relies on constraints to exclude known bad releases (in this case
networkx 2.X)

This change leverages the fact we have the requirements repo to get the
upper-constraints.txt, in a Depends-On friendly way, and then
manipulates that so that we can use it in these test jobs.

Change-Id: I88c23685e0f2f27278c23aa9e7256681639e5039
"}, {'created': '2018-07-17 04:54:47.000000000', 'message': "Use constraints when when building images

Currently the way we install diskimage-builder doesn't use constraints,
but DIB relies on constraints to exclude known bad releases (in this case
networkx 2.X)

This change leverages the fact we have the requirements repo to get the
upper-constraints.txt, in a Depends-On friendly way, and then
manipulates that so that we can use it in these test jobs.

Change-Id: I88c23685e0f2f27278c23aa9e7256681639e5039
"}]
commit_message:
Use constraints when when building images

Currently the way we install diskimage-builder doesn't use constraints,
but DIB relies on constraints to exclude known bad releases (in this case
networkx 2.X)

This change leverages the fact we have the requirements repo to get the
upper-constraints.txt, in a Depends-On friendly way, and then
manipulates that so that we can use it in these test jobs.

Change-Id: I88c23685e0f2f27278c23aa9e7256681639e5039

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-04-03 20:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Using the previous dlrn hash should be a feature of the repo-setup role. Let's look into that."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-15 14:55:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think it's better to have a separate release file for that, like previos-master.yaml, etc. Whe we can set dlrn_hash to previous-current-tripleo for example. And you can adjust containers release there, because we don't have previous-current-tripleo tag in registry afaik."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-08-25 10:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

because long time passed since last update'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 11:33:32.000000000', 'message': 'Change release to -previous if the job is an update

When testing an updates, we need to use the release file that installs
the previous known good hash at first, then the process will update to
the latest hash.

Change-Id: I45c0e90843b44c7978ac6e2aae40349f67a38084
Depends-On: I9d56606fd034415d450a32cd04e537713e340ff9
'}]
commit_message:
Change release to -previous if the job is an update

When testing an updates, we need to use the release file that installs
the previous known good hash at first, then the process will update to
the latest hash.

Change-Id: I45c0e90843b44c7978ac6e2aae40349f67a38084
Depends-On: I9d56606fd034415d450a32cd04e537713e340ff9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-11 22:23:11.000000000', 'message': "Stop collecting ephemeral temp dirs

Seeing a ton of things like:

  logs/apache/.~tmp~/keystone_wsgi_main_error.txt.gz

in the log dirs (13k for one job to be precise) Even though /tmp was
already removed, let's make sure we're not accidentally sucking these
over somehow.

Change-Id: I087e6440925de64e4bcd5120a64da306f7acc20a
"}]
commit_message:
Stop collecting ephemeral temp dirs

Seeing a ton of things like:

  logs/apache/.~tmp~/keystone_wsgi_main_error.txt.gz

in the log dirs (13k for one job to be precise) Even though /tmp was
already removed, let's make sure we're not accidentally sucking these
over somehow.

Change-Id: I087e6440925de64e4bcd5120a64da306f7acc20a

commit_message:
ovb: Remove bin/ and usr/ from working_dir tarball

This commit removes bin/ and usr/ from the quickstar.tar file to save
space. By analyzing the log contents, this accounts for 24MB out of the
log, which can be the largest portion. Since the data contained in here
shouldn't be that valuable, we should exclude it from collection.

Change-Id: Iaeb3c92f58f255805adbd9ee7487afd9293a192e

commit_message:
Fix backup tests

This patch add an additional possibility when checking instance status
after backup - backup may be done fast so we may get response 'ACTIVE'.

Change-Id: I93efba6aa11842ee2499550ab9293b65d75448e0
Story: #2005422
Task: #30444
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 18:39:55.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Run 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

Depends on commit has added the new job 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only'
which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Run the ipv6 job on trove gate also.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677014/

Story: #2005477
Task: #35937

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I2ecfcef4a03ccc574d4fd3b026183342cb1fa242
"}]
commit_message:
[train][goal] Run 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

Depends on commit has added the new job 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only'
which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Run the ipv6 job on trove gate also.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677014/

Story: #2005477
Task: #35937

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I2ecfcef4a03ccc574d4fd3b026183342cb1fa242

commit_message:
Add an OVN configuration file

This patch is adding a new ovn.yaml configuration file which can deploy
a containerized overcloud with OVN configured.

Change-Id: Iedc2cd429a00b4d95b127688517f186cb67e7f12

commit_message:
Create undercloud interfaces with multi-nic net-iso

In order to use multiple-nic network isolation, we need to
create an IP on the overcloud external network interface on
the undercloud. The simplest method for that is to use the
existing template and just specify the correct config.

Read in the network_isolation variables by adding
tq/roles/environment to the dependencies for this role.

See https://review.openstack.org/475363

Change-Id: Icd9353df12140e534337c2f5486e3d9ffef8a623

commit_message:
[Doc] Fix links to featureset files

Links to featureset files in doc/source/feature-configuration-generated.rst
were wrong and there was 404 page after going to those files from
"Feature Configuration" docs page.

This patch fixes those links that they will link to proper files
for each featureset.

Change-Id: I51e702874387ee6fb1b7b8ca68c5ea9f34c9ea1d

[{'created': '2019-08-16 18:35:01.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35937

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia247e3f22d1791c1b910f702781e7c5968c925db
"}]
commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'trove-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35937

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia247e3f22d1791c1b910f702781e7c5968c925db

This commit is the same as I890bbef764b6bae7cb71cfedaff2ce17829737fb, which was
previously applied to tripleo-common, but lost in the migration to
tripleo-ansible.

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the
AllNodesExtraMapData.

This commit restores the merge logic so that the merged hieradata from
the parameter value and the calculated hieradata is rendered in
all_nodes.json.

commit_message:
Restore AllNodesExtraMapData

This commit is the same as I890bbef764b6bae7cb71cfedaff2ce17829737fb, which was
previously applied to tripleo-common, but lost in the migration to
tripleo-ansible.

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the
AllNodesExtraMapData.

This commit restores the merge logic so that the merged hieradata from
the parameter value and the calculated hieradata is rendered in
all_nodes.json.

Change-Id: I49948f8d74c3846321af4f423a4891a71d0fabdc
Closes-Bug: #1839546

[{'created': '2019-08-23 06:35:37.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test PDF building

The change to fetch-sphinx-tarball in zuul/jobs cannot be tested
since the playbook is protected.

commit_message:
DNM: Test PDF building

The change to fetch-sphinx-tarball in zuul/jobs cannot be tested
since the playbook is protected.

Thus, add a new post playbook that runs fetch-sphinx-tarball again, it
will use the updated change from the dependency.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678336
Change-Id: Ic28912a8701cfc71180e23974af1af8925fa15bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 03:06:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox docs failure

Sphinx reports warning `html_static_path entry '_static' does not exist`
when running `tox -e docs`. This fix just removes `_static` from
option `html_static_path` in `doc/source/conf.py`.

Change-Id: Ifad4371afa096afc2d0d71f6f077a53a9e52b60a
"}, {'created': '2019-08-23 03:37:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox docs failure

Sphinx reports warning `html_static_path entry '_static' does not exist`
when running `tox -e docs`. This warning is treated as error in zuul
check. This fix just removes `_static` from
option `html_static_path` in `doc/source/conf.py`.

Closes-bug: #1841131
Change-Id: Ifad4371afa096afc2d0d71f6f077a53a9e52b60a
"}, {'created': '2019-08-23 06:08:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tox docs failure

doc/source/_static directory is required by oslo.policy sample generator.
_static directory is empty in the cinder repo but it must exist.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/571106/ dropped doc/source/_static/.placeholder
accidentally. This commit recovers the place holder file to ensure
doc/source/_static directory exists.

Closes-bug: #1841131
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix tox docs failure

doc/source/_static directory is required by oslo.policy sample generator.
_static directory is empty in the cinder repo but it must exist.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/571106/ dropped doc/source/_static/.placeholder
accidentally. This commit recovers the place holder file to ensure
doc/source/_static directory exists.

Closes-bug: #1841131
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifad4371afa096afc2d0d71f6f077a53a9e52b60a

commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561
Closes-Bug: #1841100

[{'created': '2019-08-24 12:59:48.000000000', 'message': "Unescape IPv6 addresses for ceph_nfs_bind_addr

Currently we end up with IPv6 addresses in ganesha.conf that
are encapsulated in brackets so the file isn't parsed correctly
and the ceph_nfs container fails to start.

Closes-bug: #1840983
Change-Id: I035f945df3ea0519ce8b62daa6d0b313e84a508c

"}]
commit_message:
Unescape IPv6 addresses for ceph_nfs_bind_addr

Currently we end up with IPv6 addresses in ganesha.conf that
are encapsulated in brackets so the file isn't parsed correctly
and the ceph_nfs container fails to start.

Closes-bug: #1840983
Change-Id: I035f945df3ea0519ce8b62daa6d0b313e84a508c
(cherry picked from commit 0478cd8923f3ce23c700aa2efac7a8fe518ab2ea)
(cherry picked from commit a2cbb5044ed82f8e5c2628d2945c056e170819ae)

[{'created': '2019-08-20 15:15:43.000000000', 'message': 'Adopt timers for new tenacity release

A new tenacity release has been made which changes the behaviour of the
wait_exponential function, effectively halving the multiplier. This
leads to issues in the tests where the functionality is being tested. To
resolve the issue, just double the base multiplier.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/677052

Change-Id: Ib9055871623f642a74899de8eb536a05c5365f24
'}, {'created': '2019-08-21 15:03:23.000000000', 'message': 'Adopt timers for new tenacity release

A new tenacity release [0] has been made which changes the behaviour
of the "wait_exponential" function [1], effectively halving the
multiplier. This leads to issues in the tests where the functionality
is being tested. To resolve the issue, just double the base multiplier.

This change can be used with the former and the new "wait_exponential"
code. If the older version of "tenacity" library is being used, the
waiting periods will be bigger but won't affect the behaviour. We can
avoid then enforcing the minimum version of this library. This is
desirable because this change was made in a minor release.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/677052
[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity/commit/aac4307a0aa30d7befd0ebe4212ee4fc69083a95

Change-Id: Ib9055871623f642a74899de8eb536a05c5365f24
'}]
commit_message:
Adopt timers for new tenacity release

A new tenacity release [0] has been made which changes the behaviour
of the "wait_exponential" function [1], effectively halving the
multiplier. This leads to issues in the tests where the functionality
is being tested. To resolve the issue, just double the base multiplier.

This change can be used with the former and the new "wait_exponential"
code. If the older version of "tenacity" library is being used, the
waiting periods will be bigger but won't affect the behaviour. We can
avoid then enforcing the minimum version of this library. This is
desirable because this change was made in a minor release.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/677052
[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity/commit/aac4307a0aa30d7befd0ebe4212ee4fc69083a95

Change-Id: Ib9055871623f642a74899de8eb536a05c5365f24

subject: Make the build reproducible
messages:
[{'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2017-11-07 21:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2018-01-29 14:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:02:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck

I don't understand how this has anything to do with reproducible builds. Can someone explain it?"}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

of course :). Default values of method params are used in Sphinx. So if you build docs on different computers, MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOBS value can be different and thus build of (docs) is not reproducible.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the explanation. So it seems like the fix should actually be made...'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:14:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I mean, it ain't wrong to fix up the base class too. Just seems incomplete without fixing that other spot."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:15:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

BTW, it also wouldn't offend me if your explanation were included in the commit message :)"}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-07-17 19:20:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I mean, it ain't wrong to fix up the base class too. Just seems incomplete without fixing that other spot.

But in parent class (base) this problem doesn't exists.

Commit message fixed."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 20:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

That's what I'm saying: ExecutorConductor (the base class) doesn't have a variable-by-environment value for MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOBS. It uses -1. It's NonBlockingConductor that uses a dynamic value [1]. In the docs.o.o build that shows up as 9 [2].

But note that, even if you "fixed" the __init__ method signature there, the MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOBS class variable itself is also documented, so the generated docs would still contain the dynamic value [3] unless you removed that docstring.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/taskflow/blob/master/taskflow/conductors/backends/impl_nonblocking.py#L40
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/taskflow/latest/user/conductors.html#module-taskflow.conductors.backends.impl_nonblocking
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/taskflow/latest/user/conductors.html#taskflow.conductors.backends.impl_nonblocking.NonBlockingConductor.MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOBS'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 20:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> removed that docstring.

By the way, I'm not suggesting you should actually do this. Rather, the docstring could be changed to something more generic ("...will be determined based on the number of processors available on the system..." or similar).'}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2019-08-24 19:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Default values of method params are used in Sphinx.
MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOB which is default value of max_simultaneous_jobs
contains number of CPU. Change default value in method param to None
and set it in method body. This doesn't change behaviour, only generated
docs.

Change-Id: I950e4c8702138186bfa943730be9dd97b9f060ba
Origin: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=860374
"}]
commit_message:
Make the build reproducible

Default values of method params are used in Sphinx.
MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_JOB which is default value of max_simultaneous_jobs
contains number of CPU. Change default value in method param to None
and set it in method body. This doesn't change behaviour, only generated
docs.

Change-Id: I950e4c8702138186bfa943730be9dd97b9f060ba
Origin: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=860374

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2016-10-31 23:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I think I can intuit this is going to decrease the aggregate load on container servers for expiration if you have a super dense set of expiring object rows since each worker will doing all the handling of a specific subset of the expired containers.  But it's really just removing a little bit of listing work - the updates are the same.

I'm less sure that it's as optimum a split of the actual deletion work - which is closer to where I'm currently seeing issues.

Since dfg added the time slicing based on the name I got a good solid 100X more containers in the .expiring_objects account which results in some good breathing room when I need to make a bunch of deletions of the delete marker rows - IME I'm still mostly bottlenecking on the super huge large containers that are slow to eat their expirations because they're already slammed with a backlog of .pending updates for the new writes they have coming in.

How dense are your expiring objects containers?  What are you trying to solve for - maybe the listings aren't really the main issue?  Do you want to go *deeper* than 100 for the shard count?  What's the effect for someone if they run with default of 100 shards and ~60 workers as far as load on the expirer workers.  What about if they run like that for a few years then decide they want change it - what would be motivation - what's the optimal number - what about existing rows?"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2019-08-24 18:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-29 19:44:13.000000000', 'message': 'object-expirer optimization

In multi-expirer environment (processes > 0) process number is used
to choose objects inside container to expirer. So every expirer iterate
__all__ containers and try to find own objects to expirer.
After this change shard is used to choose container name and thus
every expirer have own containers set.

Changes:
* use end_marker to iterate only containers/objects in past
* split container name to rounded timestamp and shard_id
* use shard_id to choose correct expirer server
* allow to choose shards count for expirer containter splitting

Change-Id: I885074784b1699e5e82a74750d32533e12599085
'}]
commit_message:
object-expirer optimization

In multi-expirer environment (processes > 0) process number is used
to choose objects inside container to expirer. So every expirer iterate
__all__ containers and try to find own objects to expirer.
After this change shard is used to choose container name and thus
every expirer have own containers set.

Changes:
* use end_marker to iterate only containers/objects in past
* split container name to rounded timestamp and shard_id
* use shard_id to choose correct expirer server
* allow to choose shards count for expirer containter splitting

Change-Id: I885074784b1699e5e82a74750d32533e12599085

- gate-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/17/391617/8/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial/6eb1772/ : SUCCESS in 43m 59s
- gate-swift-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/17/391617/8/check/gate-swift-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/fd4b984/ : SUCCESS in 30m 51s
- gate-swift-tox-xfs-tmp-bandit-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/17/391617/8/check/gate-swift-tox-xfs-tmp-bandit-ubuntu-xenial/6f229a7/ : SUCCESS in 3m 04s (non-voting)
- gate-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/17/391617/8/check/gate-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/cfec96a/ : SUCCESS in 31m 22s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2016-11-22 08:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2016-11-22 12:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(6 comments)

I'm not sure about the change in behaviour when the follow up REPLICATE after rsync fails (quoting commit message : "If REPLICATE command after rsync fail, count it as failure"), especially when syncing to remote regions. I want to hear some other opinions on that before approving. And I'd prefer to see some unit test coverage for that change.

Otherwise the changes look good.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2016-11-22 12:51:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Ondřej - I chatted to Kota about this in irc. 

Current behaviour after the second REPLICATE fails would be for no other remote nodes to get synced, the one remote node which successfully sync'd may have stale hashes - but they would be compared next time the replicator passes over the partition, then the hashes would differ, sync would be attempted again (but find no actual work), the second REPLICATE would hopefully succeed and hashes get recalculated.

I *think* that means that replication between nodes in a remote region may not occur so soon because the sync'd remote node may be left with a stale hashes.pkl which matches other nodes in that region, so the sync'd objects might not get replicated around the remote region until there is another REPLICATE from the local region. 

With this change the replicator would sync to another node in the remote region. Was that your intention? or was your intention to simply log the fact that the second REPLICATE had failed, but otherwise keep the same behaviour?



It bothers me that this isn't covered by tests :/"}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2016-11-23 22:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Alistair My motivation was cleanup and that change wasn't intention.

BUT I think it's completely fine to sync data to another replica in remote region, if recount of remote hashes failed. I think it's important to get data to all replicas as fast as possible and in this edge-case, we can replicate them twice accross regions."}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2016-11-25 08:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thinking of current behavior, the asynchronous replication can be accepted even if the second hashing failed. After the sync succeeded, the object should be the remote side anyway and the remote server can have various chances to sync to other nodes in the region (e.g. invalidate hash from PUT object). And more, the sync node target will be chosen randomly[1] so that the local replicator can sync to the other remote nodes in the next round.

Thought?

1: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/obj/replicator.py#L413'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-02 13:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2019-08-24 18:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
object-replicator cleanup

Changes:
* Make direct_client not override User-Agent
* Use direct_client for getting remote hashes
* Added replication_port to error messages
* Have global timeout in direct_client for getting hashes
* If REPLICATE command after rsync fail, count it as failure
* More checks for error logs in replicator unit tests
* Allow to get all hashes in direct_client.direct_get_suffix_hashes

Partial-Bug: #1550565
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Change-Id: Icb723ee9eada8728f14eca919b982492c98a24bb

commit_message:
Show only directories not files in recon device list

If you put some files/sockets/symlinks in /srv/node directory,
swift-recon will show something like this:
[2015-12-15 18:35:02] Getting unmounted drives from 1 hosts...
Not mounted: MegaSAS.log on 127.0.0.1:6000

This patch will skip anything other than directories when listing
devices.

Change-Id: I1e144d0b6c921db22389f23b5787a3023e0e17a3

commit_message:
Remove eventlet import from docs conf.py

It is not needed and create problems when trying to create the
documentation from an sdist tarball when git is installed (see [0] how
the problem will be solved in openstackdocstheme).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677868/
Change-Id: Iff0c9a4e99ecc16e495fb6283479839595037bc0

commit_message:
Support backup filtering

Support to filter backups by instance_id and all_projects(admin only by
default).

Story: #2006433
Task: #36343

Change-Id: Ia483bbafb8d106a9d46ab908cf5659f06fb3b7ed

Writing TODOs is important, of course.

commit_message:
Ignore hacking rule H101

I can't think of any examples when this has proven to
be truly useful.  Many of the entries point to
contributors who are no longer active in the community.

This rule also encourages people writing TODOs to put
their own name, which may needlessly prevent others
from helping fix issues in the code.

Change-Id: I6b749fcc459474eb6ca4ad6331de9138dd702cd0

commit_message:
Add retries when loading keystone data and fetching endpoints

We may end up loading lots of nested stacks concurrently with
convergence and those would try to discover endpoints and fetch
access info objects from keystone. This at times results in
ConnectTimeout errors from keystone. We can avoid these errors
by adding some retries.

Also adds retries to client_plugin get_endpoint() calls, which has
simillar issue.

Change-Id: I18cde971248eff5783f97c9e7a60316d7dd93431
Task: 36349

commit_message:
Use connect_retries when creating clients

When creating session clients we should use 'connect_retries'
for clients that use Adapter interface. This will
allow retries when we get ConnectTimeout errors.

Task: 36331
Change-Id: Ic526c8039c91353e772eee7b55f1d263470c86bb

[{'created': '2019-08-22 15:35:05.000000000', 'message': "ceph-base: Disable ceph-ansible firewall tasks

TripleO already manages firewall rules so we don't need to have both
enabled in the same time.
It's currently not an issue because the firewall rules aren't apply by
ceph-ansible on containerized deployment but it will be enabled soon.

Change-Id: I2b8fc3fcf757e5a24696f2d3575fe696b9cdfdf0
Co-Authored-By: Dimitri Savineau <dsavinea@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 954abc8e9b0920ef5cb7b0c997af3af0409d72b8)
"}]
commit_message:
ceph-base: Disable ceph-ansible firewall tasks

TripleO already manages firewall rules so we don't need to have both
enabled in the same time.
It's currently not an issue because the firewall rules aren't apply by
ceph-ansible on containerized deployment but it will be enabled soon.

Change-Id: I2b8fc3fcf757e5a24696f2d3575fe696b9cdfdf0
Co-Authored-By: Dimitri Savineau <dsavinea@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 954abc8e9b0920ef5cb7b0c997af3af0409d72b8)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated options for keystone eventlet server

This patch removes keystone options related to deprecated eventlet server
implementation. We do not need them because currently we use httpd to
run keystone as its wsgi application.

Change-Id: I6fe4de67dbe38257070596c345dd214115aa45ee

commit_message:
Sync deployed-server-roles-data.yaml with roles_data.yaml

Now that disable_constraints doesn't exist, these roles data files
should be identical. A followup should delete
deployed-server-roles-data.yaml when the documentation is updated to
not refer to it.

Change-Id: I42adaab0251a9ab4abdbb54fb7e28a8f89210424

commit_message:
Deprecate NeutronSriovNumVFs and neutron-sriov-host-config

Deprecating the parameter NeutronSriovNumVFs and the service
neutron-sriov-host-config. The numvfs shall be configured
using the sriov_pf type in nic configs.

Depends-On: I2923e046727c901219be693f248b7c0078331b83
Change-Id: I977a69add983cfe59f2dd82f05ebf7e11a85c25e

commit_message:
Make mistral optional for Ansible Update and Upgrade

Add option: --no-workflow to enable running ansible
update and upgrade outside of mistral.

Depends-On: I0c106cf795a6830a87790f1075889a6a4db65d22
Change-Id: I77f1a4efb5c60ffb5d7363d0343101fb6e702292

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I1bf65e1c7575940a6b1a0164d90d5aaa6cfc4b8a

commit_message:
Move cephfs and cephfs_*_pool ceph-ansible parameters in -base

We have to move these into the -base service so they are dumped in
"all" ansible group vars and correctly consumed by nfs role
when not colocated with mds.

Closes-Bug: 1840651
Change-Id: I7aec1b80e0f598fc86720d669151958ca7b2e01d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 17:02:06.000000000', 'message': 'Follow up to Option to send all portgroup data

Clarifies the code in add_ports_to_network() so that it is clear
that the ironic ports that are created in neutron are not necessarily
all pxe-enabled. Adds more comments to describe the behaviour if
non-pxe-enabled ports are created in neutron.

Fixes a typo in the corresponding release note.

This is a follow up to I8d0f4e28efb05af704839f3b92cb3dfd48d57940.

Change-Id: I94ff18bc137401ff4cd316755408c2099bb563cb
Story: 2005494
'}]
commit_message:
Follow up to Option to send all portgroup data

Clarifies the code in add_ports_to_network() so that it is clear
that the ironic ports that are created in neutron are not necessarily
all pxe-enabled. Adds more comments to describe the behaviour if
non-pxe-enabled ports are created in neutron.

Fixes a typo in the corresponding release note.

This is a follow up to I8d0f4e28efb05af704839f3b92cb3dfd48d57940.

Change-Id: I94ff18bc137401ff4cd316755408c2099bb563cb
Story: 2005494

The usage of eventlet server in keystone was already depreacted,
so we should deprecate parameters related to the feature.

Note that this patch still keeps *_bind_host and *_port as valid
parameters, to wait until the user migrate to *_endpoint, which
should be used instead.

commit_message:
Deprecate options related to eventlet server

The usage of eventlet server in keystone was already depreacted,
so we should deprecate parameters related to the feature.

Notes:
 - public_bind_host and public_port still remain as valid parameters,
   to wait until users migrate to public_endpoint, which should be
   used instead.
 - admin_endpoint does not affect keystone configuration, but it is
   not yet deprecated as it is still used when validate_service is True.

Change-Id: Ibc8023caf8ad4ee16ebc08a943bdcc9f188c73c1

commit_message:
Use default value for NovaLiveMigrationWaitForVIFPlug

The support to set config paramter NovaLiveMigrationWaitForVIFPlug
was added in I0048d1f57eeb3418b52f225f87810ea1a7250a0f which
default to true but has a condition as well, because of which
live-migration fails with timeout.

This changes removes the condition and uses the default value.

Also change Ib9fe6e1bfea1d5f62b2f2b6fdb12d16878108c3f fixes
the issue in networking-ovn project.

Change-Id: Iba2b7a94c23ff3bcc311e92b63d6c05d9cb6d065

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 17:06:41.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to promote docs job

We now use a promote job for publishing that avoids building again the
documents after merge. use this here as well.

We can only use the promote jobs when the job run in gate, so use the
same file conditions. To make those easier to sync, get rid of the
special tripleo job and use openstack-tox-docs directly.

For further details about promote jobs, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Change-Id: I8432eab9fcec488dc757eabc350ea3e6a9c53102
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to promote docs job

We now use a promote job for publishing that avoids building again the
documents after merge. use this here as well.

We can only use the promote jobs when the job run in gate, so use the
same file conditions. To make those easier to sync, get rid of the
special tripleo job and use openstack-tox-docs directly.

For further details about promote jobs, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Change-Id: I8432eab9fcec488dc757eabc350ea3e6a9c53102

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 22:40:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the success-url from openstack-tox-docs

A recent change[1] switched how the documents are archived for the
openstack-tox-docs jobs. They are now under /docs instead of /html [2].

This patch removes the success-url override for the openstack-tox-docs
jobs so that the zuul job links will point to /docs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677009/
[2] https://opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/src/branch/master/ \
    playbooks/docs/promote.yaml#L24

Change-Id: I8f637e022c78c9be63def5db0c9f1302eab6cbea
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the success-url from openstack-tox-docs

A recent change[1] switched how the documents are archived for the
openstack-tox-docs jobs. They are now under /docs instead of /html [2].

This patch removes the success-url override for the openstack-tox-docs
jobs so that the zuul job links will point to /docs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677009/
[2] https://opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/src/branch/master/ \
    playbooks/docs/promote.yaml#L24

Change-Id: I8f637e022c78c9be63def5db0c9f1302eab6cbea

commit_message:
Pass target_raid_config field to ironic variable

In order to create/delete RAID configuration via the Ansible driver
we should be able to retrieve the JSON target_raid_config data from
the node.

Change-Id: Ie1bbefbc438a6c7f4592ea96ff84d2d5eb2d412d
Story: 2006417
Task: 36307

commit_message:
Remove experimental job on openSUSE 42.3

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so
that openSUSE 42.3 can be removed completely from CI.

Note that on master this job was replaced with a newer job, but I don't
want to add a test with newer OS here.

Change-Id: I57e5517e7b77a0160f9dce38b3266e78323d522a

commit_message:
Remove experimental job on openSUSE 42.3

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so
that openSUSE 42.3 can be removed completely from CI.

Note that on master this job was replaced with a newer job, but I don't
want to add a test with newer OS here.

Change-Id: I57e5517e7b77a0160f9dce38b3266e78323d522a

commit_message:
Create tripleo-cellv2 role

This change introduce tripleo-cellv2 role and playbook
create-nova-cell-v2.yaml to simplify the post steps when creating
an additional cellv2 in tripleo. For reference, [1] is the doc
patch providing at the moment the manual steps.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/672744

Change-Id: I288a9217dce948d33d9b47938e7977294d255c7a

commit_message:
Move SnapshotsActionsTest to master skip list

These tests are failing randomly due insufficient free virtual
space (-12.0GB) to accommodate thin provisioned 1GB volume on
host hostgroup in Cinder. Increasing LVM space does not fix the
actual issue.

Investigation is in-progress. Adding it to skip list for master
promotion.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674556/

Related-Bug: #1841071

Change-Id: I0e73bc0e4b1abb761c2f5f470297b2f16928021c
Signed-off-by: Chandan kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

subject: Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-23 14:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-08-23 14:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 14:03:52.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently
merged an update to the undercloud installation that disables
the notification drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This
change adds logic for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2.

Change-Id: I75bb75092fa348dc1c2dc465446cb91d4882cf15
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 5f1b6c6e5001ed917d474bed33ca88103031de94)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently
merged an update to the undercloud installation that disables
the notification drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This
change adds logic for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2.

Change-Id: I75bb75092fa348dc1c2dc465446cb91d4882cf15
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 5f1b6c6e5001ed917d474bed33ca88103031de94)

commit_message:
Fix functional.base.TestCase.openstack() to optionally omit --os-auth-type

Change the functional test TestCase.openstack() method to add a
way to not include the --os-auth-type option in order to test the
default auth-type logic.

Adds log_filters parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-02 17:34:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_novnc to adequately validate websocket upgrade

Currently, test_novnc validates the websocket upgrade by verifying
that the websocket response reports a protocol switch and that the
response includes a server name specified in the configuration
field vnc_server_header. This explicit server name configuration
field introduces a security concern and convolutes the code base.

HTTP RFC7231 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) section 6.2.2
says that when switching protocols, the response "MUST generate
an Upgrade header field that indicates which protocols will be
switched to".

This patchset uses this required Upgrade field to validate the
websocket upgrade instead of an environment-based configuration
field, making the code base cleaner, safer, and more reliable.

Change-Id: I5d3c9bdd0d20a15ade672f276dd0f24b654e3de5
Closes-bug: #1838777

commit_message:
Fix test_novnc to adequately validate websocket upgrade

Currently, test_novnc validates the websocket upgrade by verifying
that the websocket response reports a protocol switch and that the
response includes a server name specified in the configuration
field vnc_server_header. This explicit server name configuration
field introduces a security concern and convolutes the code base.

HTTP RFC7231 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) section 6.2.2
says that when switching protocols, the response "MUST generate
an Upgrade header field that indicates which protocols will be
switched to".

This patchset uses this required Upgrade field to validate the
websocket upgrade instead of an environment-based configuration
field, making the code base cleaner, safer, and more reliable.

vnc_server_header is deprecated and necessary release notes are
created.

Change-Id: I5d3c9bdd0d20a15ade672f276dd0f24b654e3de5
Closes-bug: #1838777
Closes-bug: #1840788
